commit_message:
Request class-read object_prefix rbd_children perm

When using ceph as a backend request the additional privilege
class-read on rbd_children. This fixes bug 1696073.

Change-Id: Ie4341eb834ae6fe02424c75e31f16f1cf5411f21
Closes-Bug: #1696073
Depends-On: Icf844ec7d33f2e558dee7935fe5fa3d7f08e0d59

commit_message:
Fix npm publishing

During the conversion, the nodejs4-publish-to-npm template was replaced
with python publishing jobs by accident.

Really use nodejs4-publish-to-npm for the publishing and remove thus
legacy-npm-upload and publish-openstack-python-tarball for npm repos.

Remove also npm-tarball-upload.sh, it is only used by the
legacy-npm-upload job and thus not needed anymore.

For reference, see
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/zuul/layout.yaml?h=before-jenkins-config-removed
and check the templates used by the projects changed.

Needed-By: I696a23792f8e4056b788ad4a8b018c423aa1af68
Change-Id: I5cccd00518afcc50c575a4bb1937345a30fe584f

commit_message:
Add MySQL connection SSL support

When 'sahara_galera_use_ssl' is True, use an encrypted connection to
the database using either a self-signed or user-provided CA certificate.

A new non-voting test has been added to verify that the role remains
functional when enabling SSL features.

Change-Id: Ie39024c99cad0932f464707adc43019bc1062317
Partial-Bug: 1667789

subject: Add a new filter to EnabledExtensionManager
messages: [{'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-12-15 13:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-12-15 13:38:38.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nThat's exactly what NamedExtensionManager is supposed to solve it seems."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 13:08:41.000000000', 'message': "Add a new filter to EnabledExtensionManager

The check_func of EnabledExtensionManager operates after the extension
has already been created. If you want to skip loading altogether, it's
not good enough as the modules will already be imported, and even the
class created if invoke_on_load is True. This adds new callback that is
called before the extension is created, allowing to filter on the entry
point itself (when you already have the name).

Change-Id: I017e6bf3e077f6af5a9691d8cb29e02c929e6f9b
"}]
commit_message:
Add a new filter to EnabledExtensionManager

The check_func of EnabledExtensionManager operates after the extension
has already been created. If you want to skip loading altogether, it's
not good enough as the modules will already be imported, and even the
class created if invoke_on_load is True. This adds new callback that is
called before the extension is created, allowing to filter on the entry
point itself (when you already have the name).

Change-Id: I017e6bf3e077f6af5a9691d8cb29e02c929e6f9b

subject: This patch enables haproxy stats by properly listening on address:port
messages:
[{'account_id': 27490, 'date': '2017-12-12 12:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-12 12:37:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2017-12-15 12:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2017-12-15 13:31:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
This patch enables haproxy stats by properly listening on address:port

commit_message:
Fix apache_configs

Since we stat files now to dereference there's no need to ignore
errors anymore. The ignore error was hiding in this case a mistake
in the last step causing the apache_configs to be missing.

Change-Id: Ibd757bdf5f541eae79725697e5e2805593534bc6

commit_message:
Use the tempest plugin from openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin

Follow-on patch will delete the
openstack/ironic/ironic_tempest_plugin/ directory. But this will need
to be done after this patch has been backported to the stable
branches, otherwise the stable branches will break.

Conflicts:
  playbooks/legacy/tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-partition-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa-python3/run.yaml
  playbooks/legacy/tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-resourceclasses-partition-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa/run.yaml
  playbooks/legacy/tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipa-full/run.yaml
  zuul.d/legacy-ironic-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: I31bb088679ea122efaa91d362e613edb74c14254
(cherry picked from commit cf8b62e86b00bd4a5fe3bea4beaabbcc0cabd2d0)

commit_message:
Added ability to cleanup venv tgz, use find module

cleanup-venvs.yml now removes older venv tgz, in addition to older venvs
directories.

It now uses the more appropriate and efficient find module instead of
the shell module.

Change-Id: Iab98039a84bb4b0e787c439d67fa81b7e108c3ff

commit_message:
Monitor docker with telegraf

Add docker_port variable that holds the port of docker's tcp listener

Add configuration to telegraf to monitor docker

Change-Id: I988a4351cdac3cba01424f31a3f07c12b3cbe386
Implements: blueprint monitor-docker

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Icb8bcec5166dd151336455c69db8e4c4067ac8c5

commit_message:
Use the tempest plugin from openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin

Use the tempest plugin from openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin as we
have moved the tempest code there. Soon the tempest code will be
deleted from openstack/ironic.

Change-Id: I8e91d3ca6dd34f8e959c5f6b1e6f07b1a04080b3

commit_message:
Change log level for RestControllers

Changed all calls to log.info on the RestControllers to debug
This due to a feedback on working on a issue that the logging info was leaking
sensitive content from the env.
That data makes sense to be logged only for debug level
Envs can have up to 2GB so I added a cut to it

Change-Id: If1b71590c0904182bb8052c3e942131e57494825
Closes-Bug: #1714236

commit_message:
Refactored magnum tempest plugin

* It provides proper directory structure and cleanup of
  magnum tempest plugin tests.

* Added tools/pretty_tox.sh to trigger functional api tests

Change-Id: Ibdddd26da9cfb0d08c2977660320b2c052d7261b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 14:28:42.000000000', 'message': 'Update some l3-agent log messages

A warning message in process_delete() had an unnecessary
period since the method was wrapped with exception_logger():

 "...no router namespace found.: FloatingIpSetupException..."

Also, two debug messages were not printing the router ID,
so were pretty useless.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Ib007d81d53823b665f4f16d23c87bc887749d252
'}]
commit_message:
Update some l3-agent log messages

A warning message in process_delete() had an unnecessary
period since the method was wrapped with exception_logger():

 "...no router namespace found.: FloatingIpSetupException..."

Also, two debug messages were not printing the router ID,
so were pretty useless.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Ib007d81d53823b665f4f16d23c87bc887749d252

commit_message:
Remove dlrn_hash_tag_newest usage when it is not defined

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528022/ removed the
dlrn_hash_tag_newest definition but kept the reference to
this variable in the repo path.

This review changes the path to use dlrn_hash/dlrn_hash_tag
which are defined.

Change-Id: Ifd9a4ecf1a9d28a0ebb9345536633bbdabdc728a
Closes-Bug: 1738321

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 09:29:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix kuryr-daemon for Werkzeug 0.13

Ie7c0ddaa0091b31da2661be48e6cf40e052dcd52 updates upper-constraints to
point to Werzeug 0.13. Looks like it has non-backward compatible change
and now requires port passed to run_simple to be an integer. This commit
makes sure we're passing int instead of string.

Change-Id: I36681dd3443463fd455dccdd0c8702162c16b84f
Closes-Bug: 1738374
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kuryr-daemon for Werkzeug 0.13

Ie7c0ddaa0091b31da2661be48e6cf40e052dcd52 updates upper-constraints to
point to Werzeug 0.13. Looks like it has non-backward compatible change
and now requires port passed to run_simple to be an integer. This commit
makes sure we're passing int instead of string.

Change-Id: I36681dd3443463fd455dccdd0c8702162c16b84f
Closes-Bug: 1738374

commit_message:
Remove pip_install dependency

With addition of pip_install on every node, we don't
need to have pip_install as a meta dependency.

Depends-On: If3412bb888ebb854874bbc43eb76bfcb3e4a7868
Depends-On: I79ff70c438b44753be2a93f004ebbc46de0a963d
Change-Id: I30b5f242578804bc6ca9957d8a1177c53b435ebc

commit_message:
Add ceph_client role

The role 'ceph_client' was not found in openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer,
so add it.

Change-Id: I80053371fa6fbcd3c678f57542c92f204d4d7ccd
Closes-Bug: #1704294

commit_message:
Add MySQL connection SSL support

When 'magnum_galera_use_ssl' is True, use an encrypted connection to
the database using either a self-signed or user-provided CA certificate.

A new non-voting test has been added to verify that the role remains
functional when enabling SSL features.

Change-Id: I1ac622926542ff6a3dfca7be3703f33ede4013df
Partial-Bug: 1667789

commit_message:
Add MySQL connection SSL support

When 'ironic_galera_use_ssl' is True, use an encrypted connection to
the database using either a self-signed or user-provided CA certificate.

A new non-voting test has been added to verify that the role remains
functional when enabling SSL features.

Change-Id: I1c0598a2f83d330014ffbb2612386016347d3425
Partial-Bug: 1667789

IPA recently started requiring  hexdump to be present
inside the ramdisk image.

While a catch has been proposed, this is a likely
cause of current master branch CI failures of bifrost.

Change-Id: I946582087855e0e2fc26767126f0f87500658c69

commit_message:
Fix debian IPA build

IPA recently started requiring  hexdump to be present
inside the ramdisk image.

While a catch has been proposed, this is a likely
cause of current master branch CI failures of bifrost.

Change-Id: I946582087855e0e2fc26767126f0f87500658c69
(cherry picked from commit 27e62b11e6bfa1937ee622b4f612bf6c0f404b46)

commit_message:
Make ipxe boot script templatable

This patch allows the custom iPXE boot script that bifrost supplies
to use the templating feature provided by ironic since Ocata release.

In the long run this will also be needed to support the
Dynamic iPXE Configuration feature.

Change-Id: I21f7f8433277349ad01323ead6ecd277a0b61e3b

commit_message:
Add MySQL connection SSL support

When 'heat_galera_use_ssl' is True, use an encrypted connection to
the database using either a self-signed or user-provided CA certificate.

A new non-voting test has been added to verify that the role remains
functional when enabling SSL features.

Change-Id: I8d582a5fe18b33592461f3ea23551c97720b8e7d
Partial-Bug: 1667789

commit_message:
Add MySQL connection SSL support

When 'tacker_galera_use_ssl' is True, use an encrypted connection to
the database using either a self-signed or user-provided CA certificate.

A new non-voting test has been added to verify that the role remains
functional when enabling SSL features.

Change-Id: I9165a04de869197ac05e60be799f59a263e98a7b
Partial-Bug: 1667789

commit_message:
Implements: Heat template for integrating Cavium SmartNIC LiquidIO

Contains Tripleo Heat templates to deploy Liquidio Compute nodes.
Creates a New role ComputeLiquidio, which contains Cavium SmartNIC.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 14:21:06.000000000', 'message': 'Drop zeromq support

Support for the ZeroMQ messaging driver has bit-rotted over the
last few years across the OpenStack charms; drop support for ZMQ
inline with deprecation notices issues in 17.02 charm release.

Change-Id: I66330dd29972e39e45e9bf81cb0570d5749b8312
'}]
commit_message:
Drop zeromq support

Support for the ZeroMQ messaging driver has bit-rotted over the
last few years across the OpenStack charms; drop support for ZMQ
inline with deprecation notices issues in 17.02 charm release.

Change-Id: I66330dd29972e39e45e9bf81cb0570d5749b8312

commit_message:
Rename 'top-5 help wanted' to 'help most needed'

We should not wait to have 5 areas needing help to publish the
list, nor always have 5 areas on the list.

Change-Id: I664cfc6faeaf15b8adcbc47ceb490e6435d164b1

commit_message:
correct ha proxy configuration for opendaylight

- There is no need of two haproxy services for ODL to access
ODL neutron and other REST webservices. It can still be
accessed on 8180 port.
- Add the ha proxy configuration for opendaylight web socket
which is used for neutron event subscriptions. If it is not
done, then neutron server log is continiously filled up with
webscoket error with full stracktrace.

Change-Id: I2c146cdca0ab598be85ea5c1d3d1b634e5a69409
Signed-off-by: Periyasamy Palanisamy <periyasamy.palanisamy@ericsson.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-10-09 18:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2017-10-09 20:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I believe there to be many active champions and stewards across OpenStack today.  Adding a call for more to top-5 seems that it may reduce the participation of the existing set (as they may feel unrecognised).  I don't believe the SWG as a place for Stewards was a particularly good way to make them appear, as many are mostly active in their corners of the community, helping bridge gaps between projects, supporting new projects, and ensuring discussions support activities that affect several aspects of OpenStack: from that perspective, what happens at "higher" levels is not necessarily relevant, as long as one is able to successfully pursue one's agenda to develop consensus and make progress.

While it may be true that it would be good to have more folk who make things happen and coordinate efforts be known to others, and there is no limit to the number of such folk that could usefully improve the OpenStack project, those who are most effective will be effective because they are solving actual problems, rather than those that seek a title or respond to this call.

In my opinion, a strong encouragement for all community participants to take the actions suggested in this patch, perhaps combined with some metric to provide incentive for funding of these activities would go a lot farther than asking for more folk to help in this area.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-09 21:15:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-governance-linters-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/56/510656/1/check/gate-governance-linters-ubuntu-xenial/cd9f6e6/ : SUCCESS in 3m 00s
- gate-governance-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/56/510656/1/check/gate-governance-docs-ubuntu-xenial/88538cc//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 30s'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-10-10 08:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from top-5-champions to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-10-10 15:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

I'm pro this, but I think it needs some adjustments to change the focus slightly.

I think there are plenty of people who would like to "volunteer" to do the kind of work described here, but they need their employers to be more aware of the need. This doc is pitched a bit towards people who want to volunteer and I think it needs to be pitched more towards the people managing potential contributors. 

Dear companies: this stuff is important and you have people in your org who want to do it, let them, but when you let them you must absolutely make sure that you aren't just adding to what they are already doing, these things take time and energy, so something they are doing needs to go away.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-10-10 16:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

 > 
 > Dear companies: this stuff is important and you have people in your
 > org who want to do it, let them, but when you let them you must
 > absolutely make sure that you aren't just adding to what they are
 > already doing, these things take time and energy, so something they
 > are doing needs to go away.

I agree. Pushing others to get involved and drive community goals would be a huge help. Speaking from experience, driving a community goal requires a *lot* of time.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-10-15 08:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
add "champions and stewards" as a top-5 help wanted area

Round out our top 5 help wanted list with a general call for
assistance from people who will serve as goal champions, or otherwise
help drive cross-project initiatives.

Change-Id: I683cb7182fc0b6b99c005e277b8807d334ee7f79
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Was the debate about naming and namespacing on the mailing list properly resolved? There seemed to be some suggestions that a sort of prefix notation (sig-self-healing) might be right but that was then countered by "let's just use the names people use" (self-healing-sig).

As long as we are consistent...'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-05 13:54:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

From my perspective, the upshot is that renames in Gerrit and Storyboard aren't too hard if we decide later that it's ambiguous... so moving forward for now lets people get work done and we can worry about picking a different name if and when it ever becomes necessary."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-12-08 02:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-08 05:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-12 13:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2017-12-04 21:44:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add an openstack/self-healing-sig repository

The Self-healing SIG is interested in using Storyboard for task
tracking purposes. At the moment our means of avoiding name
collisions is to make sure each project in SB has a matching
repository in Gerrit, so create the necessary repo as a placeholder
(it may be used for revision control of documents or other artifacts
pertaining to the SIG in the future, but they have no actual plans
for it at this time).

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Self-healing_SIG
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-sigs/2017-December/000198.html

commit_message:
Add an openstack/self-healing-sig repository

The Self-healing SIG is interested in using Storyboard for task
tracking purposes. At the moment our means of avoiding name
collisions is to make sure each project in SB has a matching
repository in Gerrit, so create the necessary repo as a placeholder
(it may be used for revision control of documents or other artifacts
pertaining to the SIG in the future, but they have no actual plans
for it at this time).

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Self-healing_SIG
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-sigs/2017-December/000198.html

Change-Id: Ie2bba5e8914eb5422974b968183498471fae37cb
Depends-On: If4fed236b6a679a635e17984f1cd07e98e21758c

commit_message:
[task] include contexts execution results

Using atomic action for contexts gives a bunch of benefits:

* collect timings about how much time setup and cleanup methods take
* save the timestamp when each of contexts was executed

Also, this patch renames "context" and "context_execution" fields of
database to "contexts" and "contexts_results" since these names sound
more clear.

Change-Id: I9b344286c9a6cccfb4ab4a78289877d7318fc75d

From Kilo onwards the swift-proxy charm is
misconfiguring the swift3 middleware such that
the api is unable to respond to any requests.
We fix this by providing working config for
Kilo onwards.

Closes-Bug: 1738063

commit_message:
Fix S3 API for >= Kilo

From Kilo onwards the swift-proxy charm is
misconfiguring the swift3 middleware such that
the api is unable to respond to any requests.
We fix this by providing working config for
Kilo onwards.

NOTE: see LP for full explanation but due to
problems with package version mismatches in the
UCA this patch only fixes Trusty Kilo, (L is
EOL) and Xenial Mitaka.

Change-Id: Ice5690e7f06ffc78dd20b53b67dffc6bd72b2613
Closes-Bug: 1738063

DNM: Test npm-run-test

Check that the dependend change works and npm-run-test is fixed for
horizon again.

This adds zuul.yaml with a single job that tests npm-run-test.

messages:
[{'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-12-11 14:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This also looks like it has new features, so it could be 4.1.0.'}, {'account_id': 10787, 'date': '2017-12-11 22:25:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I might be wrong, but that shouldn't be the case. What do you mean Doug?"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-15 08:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

subject: Release kolla 4.0.3
messages:
[{'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-12-11 14:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:21:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It would be good to review the changes going into this release and see if any are features and make it 4.1.0 if there are (it seems like there are some to me, but I can't tell with a quick review)."}, {'account_id': 10787, 'date': '2017-12-11 22:21:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I don't think we have any features - we don't backport features, only bugfixes"}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-12-12 01:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

agree with inc0. 

feature is not backported.

But we has the case that bump y stream for openstack service. like

  * Bump neutron-fwaas from 10.0.1 to 10.1.0

no idea whether this can be treat as "feature".'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-12 13:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> agree with inc0.
 > 
 > feature is not backported.
 > 
 > But we has the case that bump y stream for openstack service. like
 > 
 > * Bump neutron-fwaas from 10.0.1 to 10.1.0
 > 
 > no idea whether this can be treat as "feature".

I was interpreting the commit "Adding python-rtslib to cinder-volume for lioadm support" as adding support for something new. Maybe it's just fixing existing support?'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-12-12 14:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Doug Hellmann wrote:

> > agree with inc0.
 > 
 > feature is not backported.
 > 
 > But we has the case that bump y stream for openstack service. like
 > 
 > * Bump neutron-fwaas from 10.0.1 to 10.1.0
 > 
 > no idea whether this can be treat as "feature".
>
> I was interpreting the commit "Adding python-rtslib to cinder-volume
> for lioadm support" as adding support for something new. Maybe it's
> just fixing existing support?

@doug

In kolla, this is only add packages in images. this is harded treated as features in kolla.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-12-14 06:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@doug update for this?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-15 08:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Yes, "features" in deployment systems are a different beasts. Approving since this does not follow standard stable policy anyway.'}]

Release kolla 4.0.3

commit_message:
Don't wait for stack in progress in delete

We don't need to wait for the stack to be in progress when deleting it,
and it can in fact be a race condition if it disappears too fast. Just
skip to check if it still exists.

Change-Id: Idbbb7afd4ab0157c870e1c1e3cd1666fb99651cc

commit_message:
Do not try unmounting the EFI partition if it was not mounted

If mounting the root partition fails for some reason, we try to unmount
the EFI partition, which is not mounted at this point. This results in
a new exception hiding the real failure. This change fixes it.

Change-Id: I0ec636a361eda71b4149e4a7ba1538a9bbf6ec34
Closes-Bug: #1732932

commit_message:
Improve translation jobs

Looking at [1], I see "Cannot rebase: You have unstaged changes.", let's
add a "git status" to see what might be the reason.

Looking at [2], an error occurs since releasenotes/source/locale is not
under version control. This can happen if the project has translated
files on a branch from copying. Ignore the failure.

[1]
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/master/propose-translation-update/dda4792/job-output.txt.gz
[2]
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/trove-dashboard/stable/pike/propose-translation-update/8deef07/job-output.txt.gz

Change-Id: Ia4f4863a60a64d5f6333e4550a548b8ed3fe56f5

commit_message:
Expose logs from nova_libvirt container

By default logs for libvirt are disabled. However, for debugging
purposes they might be enabled but are only available within the
container. This change bind mounts the log directory to the host.

Change-Id: I4a69e39355a332872ab40663d85a0bc15b98dcf4

commit_message:
kubernetes: get it working on AArch64 as well

In past I disabled those images on non-x86 because had lot of other
things to do. Now it is time to get it running on aarch64 too.

Had to revert rename done in 5a530be776c4897523e3419e69d798de0dc1755c
so backward compatibility is broken ;(

Change-Id: I44160dfb1d151e97d473e6c13194e043657094a8
Partially-Implements: blueprint multiarch-and-arm64-containers

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I28ba0904389699268d4b256f76fbfa3a6792eda0

commit_message:
Add a tag to all the role specific parameters

With parameter tags, it is possible to categorize the parameters.
In this patch, all role-specific parameters of the services are
categorized as role_specific, which will help in adding validation
during the deployment (to ensure the provided role-specific
parameter is actually implemented as role-specific). This patch
adds only the tags, and the validation will done via workflows.

Change-Id: Ic053111298e7872a3a3cd11e6249dbd85707cc29

commit_message:
Break up messages to avoid max message size

Messages posted back to a zaqar queue by the ansible-playbook action
could easily exceed the max message size for the queue. Instead of
posting a single message each time, break it up based on the max message
size and post a separate message for each.

Change-Id: If51416120b690c28cff4e909799246c16cd96fc0
Closes-Bug: #1737026

This is required to enable, configure and manage AIDE (Advanced
Intrustion Detection System).

Jobs are currently failing due to an "ansible-playbook" command not

Move the set -ex before activate_venv so that it not only fails fast

commit_message:
Move set -ex to occur before activate_venv

Jobs are currently failing due to an "ansible-playbook" command not
found. It seems like the virtualenv is not being sourced properly.

Move the set -ex before activate_venv so that it not only fails fast
if it's not able to source the venv but also provides tracing to
understand what's going on.

Change-Id: Ic98679b5c62716a3abeb11abc201b67d1abf9fde

subject: Add Nova max_concurrent_builds, rpc response timeout to undercloud conf
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17823, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@redhat.com', 'username': 'mbaldessari'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-12-13 15:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-12-13 19:47:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-13 22:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I was unaware this was a thing in quickstart and would like to not continue for it to be a thing. If this is something an end user would want to do for reasons, it should be in the undercloud install itself a not handled this way. This is not the fault of this patch but we should not be continuing this pattern.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-12-14 06:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I was unaware this was a thing in quickstart and would like to not
 > continue for it to be a thing. If this is something an end user
 > would want to do for reasons, it should be in the undercloud
 > install itself a not handled this way. This is not the fault of
 > this patch but we should not be continuing this pattern.

I get the general idea behind this comment, but I also think that adding every single potential option that hides behind a hiera key in the undercloud install process is not really feasible either?

I wonder if we can explore a mechanism in oooq where a user can simply pass a dict to oooq and it will be just transformed into hiera key=value pairs. That way we have some flexibility of setting hiera keys in oooq for developers that need it. How horrible does that thought sound?'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-14 15:31:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The point is that if a customer would need to tune this, then we need to investigate improving how we expose that. Either we handle these tunings automatically or we should be exposed via some setting in the undercloud.conf. Since most of these are workers/timeouts tunings, we could provide a profile concept or using $::os_workers/$::cpu_count.  The problem with this implementation is that it's CI only.  No one outside of CI/developers are getting these optimizations by putting them here."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-12-14 16:04:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

OK I'm trying to get my head around what specifically is "the thing":

1. are you unsatisfied that undercloud.conf has a parameter called hieradata_override ?    that's part of instack-undercloud.   but it sounds like this is what you're saying when you say "should be exposed via some setting in the undercloud.conf."

2. are you unsatisfied that oooq has (actually two) pre-fab .yaml templates that are hardwired to this conf setting, and within those .yaml files are a whole bunch of hardcoded tuning parameters?   I can make a patch that gives one the ability to generate a totally open-ended hieradata_override file, if that helps.

My situation is that I currently have a shell script that has to do this:

./quickstart.sh  <undercloud only tags>
ssh -F ~classic/.quickstart/ssh.config.local.ansible undercloud 'bash -s' < optimize_undercloud.sh
./quickstart.sh <overcloud only tags>

where optimize_undercloud is:

yum install -y openstack-utils

openstack-config --set /etc/nova/nova.conf DEFAULT rpc_response_timeout 600
openstack-config --set /etc/nova/nova.conf DEFAULT max_concurrent_builds 2
openstack-config --set /etc/ironic/ironic.conf DEFAULT rpc_response_timeout 600
openstack-service restart nova
openstack-service restart ironic


e.g. I have to run an ugly script between two separate runs of quickstart.     I was hoping this patch could go right in so I can continue my work, I'm wasting lots of time just getting my clouds to build when i need to have something working on top of it by next week


if you can advise an acceptable approach that is local to oooq without having to get packages of instack etc. built please advise !'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-14 16:10:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So I've always hated this interface in instack-undercloud. That being said, what I'm trying to understand why you have to do this at all and would it be beneficial for a customer to do this. If the answer to the latter question is yes, then it should become a primary configuration option within undercloud.conf as it could be easily documented & consumed by customers. If this is specific to CI or development, we need a better explanation as to why we should do this in quickstart only and why this isn't something a customer would need to do. This seems like a tuning that needs to be exposed to an end user in a well documented way and putting it in quickstart is simply papering over the issue for your needs without considering the real consumer of the software."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-12-14 16:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The issues I'm usually addressing with oooq patches are always to do w/ the fact that deploying on virtual machines for overcloud nodes presents performance issues that are not typical on real hardware, like the one w/ the virtual file device caching we dealt with some months ago.  Since I'm on the HA team I'm always deploying an HA setup, so that means I'm running five VMs for one overcloud; and at the moment, I'm actually deploying *two* entirely distinct undercloud/overclouds, both HA, so I'm running *ten* VMs on one hypervisor (it's 8 cores, 188G of ram, so it can handle it, but still needs a little bit of tweaking to succeed consistently).    I'm of course deploying only one overcloud at a time but when the second one is deploying, there's already a lot running on the hypervisor.

The specific issue is that when you watch the overcloud deploy, and you look at "nova list" on the undercloud, the VMs get stuck in SPAWNING, and eventually the overcloud deploy fails with "No valid host was found. There are not enough hosts available.".  This is something I've been working around for a long time as trying to deploy an HA setup on a smaller machine or laptop also hits this issue fairly consistently; it's just now I'm having to automate these tweaks being made.

The origin of these settings for me is from https://keithtenzer.com/2015/10/14/howto-openstack-deployment-using-tripleo-and-the-red-hat-openstack-director/ search for "Since we are in nested virtual environment it is necessary to tweak timeouts."    It's a two year old post but these settings still save the day for me even using latest master.

IIUC an actual customer would not be deploying overclouds on virtualized baremetal, they'd be using real hardware (and also...they wouldn't be using oooq?  not sure).'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-14 17:16:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Right so we solved this in the overcloud by providing an environment file that can be used when in a low memory environment. https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/environments/low-memory-usage.yaml 

That way it's actually consumable outside by others.  We do a really bad job at communicating the ways to tune for various cases.  This is going to continue that by hiding it in quickstart.  So given that you're case is really only for dev/CI it makes sense to do it in quickstart for now.   I'm just trying to ensure that there isn't an actual use case for customers where we should be improving how we configure this."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-15 03:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

Change-Id: Ib46fd4cf82dc587bd92e0d1a6f221006ca922078

Running multiple-controller/compute overcloud builds on virtualized
hardware frequently leads to the issue that Nova hangs up
during spawning of instances.   Reducing the number of

Change-Id: Ib46fd4cf82dc587bd92e0d1a6f221006ca922078
'}]
commit_message:
Add Nova max_concurrent_builds, rpc response timeout to undercloud conf

Running multiple-controller/compute overcloud builds on virtualized
hardware frequently leads to the issue that Nova hangs up
during spawning of instances.   Reducing the number of
concurrent spawns to a low number like 2 as well as increasing
nova and ironic rpc response time to a value like 600 typically
resolves this issue; this patch allows the parameters to be part of the
undercloud conf extra parameters.

Change-Id: Ib46fd4cf82dc587bd92e0d1a6f221006ca922078

commit_message:
Assert X-Newest and X-Backend headers are propagated to symlink target

Adds some assertions to verify that X-Newest and X-Backend-* headers are
copied from an original object GET requets to the symlink target
request.

[{'created': '2017-10-10 13:21:06.000000000', 'message': "Make docker_storage_driver a str instead of enum

Allow any value to be passed on the docker_storage_driver field by turning it
into a StringField (was EnumField), and remove the constraints limiting the
values to 'devicemapper' and 'overlay'.

Change the docker storage setup to have a generic setup for all drivers with
the exception of 'devicemapper', which keeps its own specific storage config
function. For all others, do the same we already did for overlay (with two
cases for usage of a cinder volume or not) and simply set the storage driver
in the docker configuration to the value provided in the cluster template.

commit_message:
Make docker_storage_driver a str instead of enum

Allow any value to be passed on the docker_storage_driver field by turning it
into a StringField (was EnumField), and remove the constraints limiting the
values to 'devicemapper' and 'overlay'.

Change the docker storage setup to have a generic setup for all drivers with
the exception of 'devicemapper', which keeps its own specific storage config
function. For all others, do the same we already did for overlay (with two
cases for usage of a cinder volume or not) and simply set the storage driver
in the docker configuration to the value provided in the cluster template.

Change-Id: I9aa8f232ce64ece4d439c0a476f463820a499617
Closes-Bug: #1722522

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 06:25:34.000000000', 'message': 'Added unit test (induces syntax change for a currently unused resource)

The "." is a reserved character in YAML for hashes. In puppet world,
we commonly use "::".

Unit tests don't work if we let the "dot" separator, and apparently it's
an intended outcome with that kind of syntax.

Change-Id: I78625a6e69f58dfb2bbad83fdd4f798cd3f4c281
'}, {'created': '2017-12-07 10:33:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add unit test for tripleo::haproxy::service_endpoints

In order to get a proper unit test suits, we need to change the
separator from the "dot" to "double-semicolons".

The "." is a reserved character in YAML for hashes. In puppet world,
we commonly use "::".

Unit tests don't work if we let the "dot" separator, and apparently it's
an intended outcome with that kind of syntax.

Fact it's working in the deploy process is kind of black magic (see the
tripleo::firewall::service_rules resource for example). And the "dot"
creates something weird, as all other resources are using the standard
double-semicolon.

Change-Id: I78625a6e69f58dfb2bbad83fdd4f798cd3f4c281
'}, {'created': '2017-12-08 03:24:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add unit test for tripleo::haproxy::service_endpoints

commit_message:
Add unit test for tripleo::haproxy::service_endpoints

In order to get a proper unit test suits, we need to change the
separator from the "dot" to "double-semicolons".

The "." is a reserved character in YAML for hashes. In puppet world,
we commonly use "::".

Unit tests don't work if we let the "dot" separator, and apparently it's
an intended outcome with that kind of syntax.

Fact it's working in the deploy process is kind of black magic (see the
tripleo::firewall::service_rules resource for example). And the "dot"
creates something weird, as all other resources are using the standard
double-semicolon.

Change-Id: I78625a6e69f58dfb2bbad83fdd4f798cd3f4c281
Closes-Bug: 1737086

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3

Story: 2001238
Task: 5764
Task: 5765

(cherry picked from commit cdc3acb279b818857cc7abb12bfc5b08b2ff5338)

Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

(cherry picked from commit a80537774facf90079091ebd5527038ac7341d45)

Change-Id: I263b1a92a9ec7b5e38d9c1dc8b02e214102a92c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 11:06:37.000000000', 'message': 'Test alloc_cands with one RP shared between two RPs

This patch proposes three new test cases that tries to cover the cases
when a shared RP is connect to two non shared RPs.

The first case looks simple:

    CN1 (VCPU)        CN2 (VCPU)
        \ agg1        / agg1
         SS1 (DISK_GB)

Then both VCPU and DISK_GB are requested and we get two allocation
candidates as expected.

Then the second case changes only that CN2 connects to SS1 via a
separate aggregate:

    CN1 (VCPU)        CN2 (VCPU)
        \ agg1        / agg2
         SS1 (DISK_GB)

This also works as expected.

Then in the third case both CNs will be connected to an additional,
separate, sharing RP in the following way:

       CN1 (VCPU)          CN2 (VCPU)
      / agg3   \ agg1     / agg1   \ agg2
  SS3 (IPV4)   SS1 (DISK_GB)      SS2 (IPV4)

Then VCPU, DISK_GB  nd IPV4 is requested. However in this case besides
the expected candidates we get invalid candidates mixing CN1 with SS2
and CN2 with SS3.

Change-Id: I2c815ef0f10120735051429f5c290a49d8d1b11e

commit_message:
Test alloc_cands with one RP shared between two RPs

This patch proposes two new test cases that tries to cover the cases
when a sharing RP is connected to two non sharing RPs.

Then the first case only differs from the previously covered scenario
that is connects the two CNs to the sharing RP via two different
aggregates:

    CN1 (VCPU)        CN2 (VCPU)
        \ agg1        / agg2
         SS1 (DISK_GB)

This works as expected.

Then in the third case both CNs will be connected to an additional,
separate, sharing RP in the following way:

       CN1 (VCPU)          CN2 (VCPU)
      / agg3   \ agg1     / agg1   \ agg2
  SS3 (IPV4)   SS1 (DISK_GB)      SS2 (IPV4)

Then VCPU, DISK_GB and IPV4 resources are requested. However in this
case besides the expected candidates we get invalid candidates mixing
CN1 with SS2 and CN2 with SS3.

Related-Bug: #1732707
Change-Id: I2c815ef0f10120735051429f5c290a49d8d1b11e

subject: Test alloc_cands with non overlapping sharing RPs

commit_message:
Test alloc_cands with non overlapping sharing RPs

This change set contains an additional functional test demonstrating
broken-ness in AllocationCandidates.get_by_filters when all the
providers in the database are sharing providers but all of them provides
resources from unique resource classes.

Change-Id: Ibb4b147d79a3757ae163bdf3f790bbcee59ecbda
Related-Bug: #1730730

subject: handle traits with sharing providers

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-01 22:14:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: handle traits with sharing providers

DO NOT MERGE

Filtering allocation candidates on a set of required traits when there
are sharing providers in the deployment adds a lot of complexity. This
is just a simple fact of life, unfortunately. We have to play a sort of
game of scheduling Tetris whereby after we have grabbed the list of
resource providers that have access to local or shared inventory for
requested resources, we then need to ensure that the group of resource
providers that comprise the allocation request have ALL of the required
traits collectively between them.

This patch adds support for filtering allocation candidates by a set of
required traits when there are sharing providers in the deployment. The
code could still use additional cleanup, in particular there are areas
in the (now even larger) _alloc_candidates_with_shared() function that
do a lookup of a resource provider internal ID by traversing the list of
resource provider summaries looking for a resource provider by UUID.
These areas of the function should be refactored and a UUID -> ID lookup
hash created to remove this duplicate code.

Change-Id: Ia2295414654abf0e282926be6cd068189cd75352
'}, {'created': '2017-11-02 15:50:25.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: handle traits with sharing providers

commit_message:
handle traits with sharing providers

Filtering allocation candidates on a set of required traits when there
are sharing providers in the deployment adds a lot of complexity. This
is just a simple fact of life, unfortunately. We have to play a sort of
game of scheduling Tetris whereby after we have grabbed the list of
resource providers that have access to local or shared inventory for
requested resources, we then need to ensure that the group of resource
providers that comprise the allocation request have ALL of the required
traits collectively between them.

This patch adds support for filtering allocation candidates by a set of
required traits when there are sharing providers in the deployment. The
code could still use additional cleanup, in particular there are areas
in the (now even larger) _alloc_candidates_with_shared() function that
do a lookup of a resource provider internal ID by traversing the list of
resource provider summaries looking for a resource provider by UUID.
These areas of the function should be refactored and a UUID -> ID lookup
hash created to remove this duplicate code.

Change-Id: Ia2295414654abf0e282926be6cd068189cd75352

subject: Migrate dsvm functional test jobs to project repo
messages:
[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-04 04:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-04 14:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Functional test failure is due to the legacy job not having appropriate permissions to create hard links.

The py27 and py35 failures are due to bug https://launchpad.net/bugs/1736005 , which is being addressed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524987/'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-05 18:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-06 18:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(The recheck was to clear the failures on openstack-tox-py{27,25} after Change-Id: I13c8f4e71841c4765bd0fff80858a2683602d1db had merged in the requirements repo.)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-11 17:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-11 17:52:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-11 21:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The legacy-glanceclient-dsvm-* jobs are an expected failure due to devstack installation not completing.  The glanceclient-dsvm-* jobs are written to replace the legacy jobs.  Those are failing because of Bug #1737583, which is addressed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527165/'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-11 22:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-12 20:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-12 20:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Trying something out.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-13 13:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Workflow

NOTE: This patch runs the functional test gate without SSL.  I think we can go ahead and merge it to get the glanceclient pipeline unstuck, but we will agree not to cut any python-glanceclient release until this has been fixed.  (Just want to point that out explicitly to reviewers.)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2017-12-14 11:08:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Thanks Brian,

I think, like discussed yesterday, that it's more important to have the functional tests running at all than waiting for the ssl issues to be fixed."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-14 15:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-14 15:39:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-14 19:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The dependency has merged.  This is ready to go!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-12-15 03:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thank you Brian!'}]

commit_message:
Migrate dsvm functional test jobs to project repo

Migrate legacy dsvm functional test jobs for python-glanceclient
to the project repository as zuul3 jobs using the devstack
functional base job.

Co-authored-by: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Needed-By: I0b974bf60da6bafabeb037a75ac10654e2a6406c
Needed-By: I0271a1430843ef546e991a7a3c4b572b3e404963
Depends-On: I84de60181cb88574e341ff83cd4857cce241f2dd
Change-Id: I1977ee0d348645987107c2efb5b454d7f8b81adf

commit_message:
Use load-edit directive for specs field

This patch uses load-edit directive for Spec field on
Profile creation dialog and Policy creation dialog.

commit_message:
Add negative test for attaching an attached volume to the same instance

This scenario came up during the volume multi-attach spec review in
Nova and is something we should be sure is not allowed with a
volume that is already attached since Nova does not yet support
volume multi-attach.

Change-Id: I98e25554d39449178df696a0d90cc62b662eda24
Depends-On: Ifc01dbf98545104c998ab96f65ff8623a6db0f28

commit_message:
Add create and import key pair actions

This patch adds create and import keypair actions into
Angularized key pair panel as global action.

Also, to load public key from file, this patch uses
load-edit directive.

To use load-edit directive from angular-schema-form,
i.e. from separated scope, this patch enables to configure
callback function to get content of textarea in load-edit.

Change-Id: Ie38bff8fba90de99095b589d70da45dcb202fa56
Imprements: blueprint ng-keypair
Needed-By: I3d6ae0b513120cf50c89b40234b602b816adfd48
Needed-By: I9200baa585c18095656d0459c649391b61b553a2

commit_message:
Handle Pike changes for Nova

- Deprecated the use_baremetal_filters according to upstream
  nova documentation [1] [2], mentioning its deprecation in Pike.
- Deprecated the metadata_host and metadata_port according to [1].
- Deprecated the firewall_driver according to [1].

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/pike.html#deprecation-notes
[2]: https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic/

Change-Id: Ic70b1db72c45c91ca928f17725a9cf0ec1cdc644

commit_message:
tests: Increase coverage of requirements parsing

This is mostly an exercise in refactoring, moving tests into a single
test case. An additional test is added, however, verifying that default
requirement files are indeed used if nothing else is provided.

Change-Id: I8dc6cc8c50f1280f24731480501fab61fc401809

commit_message:
mongodb: handle "user already exists" error on Debian

When we install 'mongodb-server' package in Debian/stable it errors out
because 'mongodb' user already exists.

It was reported [1] and got resolved in Debian/testing.

1. https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=858903

Change-Id: Iabfcbf68a3aea9d7b09b72eb3e8325f09c2f9d31

in-place substitution of the format string. The "$R" will be replaced
with a random string, the "$I" will be replaced with the node index.
The "n" in the format string is optional. When specified, it creates the

commit_message:
Name generator util function

This adds a name generator function for cluster nodes. When provided
with a fmt that has "$nR" or "$nI" in it, the util function will perform
in-place substitution of the format string. The "$R" will be replaced
with a random string, the "$I" will be replaced with the node index.
The "n" in the format string is optional. When specified, it creates the
random string of given length, or a string representation of node index
left padded with 0s.

Change-Id: I6dfd95be4a315917bbc4920678921618df4792c0

[{'created': '2017-12-14 11:27:02.000000000', 'message': "V2/V3 jsonschema validation: snapshots

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Snapshots API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/snapshots
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/snapshots/{snapshot_id}
* POST /v2/{project_id}/snapshots
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/snapshots/{snapshot_id}

V2/V3 APIs accepts 'name' and 'description' parameters instead
'display_name' and 'display_description' as these were used in
V1. So removed these parameters from schema. If user passes these
parameters in request body, it will raise 400 error.

Made changes to unit tests to pass body as keyword argument as wsgi
calls action method [1] and passes body as keyword argument.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py#L997
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I365d5b6fd1bd132024690b9870d57b548e10a0e1
"}]
commit_message:
V2/V3 jsonschema validation: snapshots

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Snapshots API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/snapshots
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/snapshots/{snapshot_id}
* POST /v2/{project_id}/snapshots
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/snapshots/{snapshot_id}

V2/V3 APIs accepts 'name' and 'description' parameters instead
'display_name' and 'display_description' as these were used in
V1. So removed these parameters from schema. If user passes these
parameters in request body, it will raise 400 error.

Made changes to unit tests to pass body as keyword argument as wsgi
calls action method [1] and passes body as keyword argument.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py#L997
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I365d5b6fd1bd132024690b9870d57b548e10a0e1

commit_message:
Remove the unnecessary register.yml from upgrade.yml for Nova

upgrade action no need to create endpoint, project, user, and role.
so the register.yml is unnecessary for upgrade.yml. this patch to
remove it.

Change-Id: I7e8d2c03cc596a551cd3e4b9b5214098d666f7ca
Closes-Bug: #1737071
Co-Authored-By: chenqiaomin <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

As an operator I want to be able to monitor the status
of RabbitMQ by collecting metrics such as queue length,
message rates (globally and per channel), and information
about resource usage on the host, such as memory use,
open file descriptors and the state of the cluster. Whilst

commit_message:
Add configurable rabbitmq monitoring user

As an operator I want to be able to monitor the status
of RabbitMQ by collecting metrics such as queue length,
message rates (globally and per channel), and information
about resource usage on the host, such as memory use,
open file descriptors and the state of the cluster. Whilst
it is possible to gather all of this information using
the OpenStack RabbitMQ user configured by Kolla Ansible,
this user has write access to the OpenStack vhost. This
feature adds a monitoring user which has access to all of
the information described above, but does not have write
access. An example of a service which may use the
monitoring user is the RabbitMQ plugin for the Monasca
Agent. As not all users will configure monitoring, by
default the monitoring user is disabled. To create it,
the user should override the rabbitmq_monitoring_user
variable.

Implements: blueprint add-monitoring-user-for-rabbit
Change-Id: Ie895ddc59dda1c38faab6305163d9bed6710ff9d

commit_message:
Remove the ceilometer api and move bootstrap into notification

since the ceilometer-api is marked as deprecated and useless, it should
be remove from kolla, but bootstrap action is need, so move it into
notification is a good choice.
refer to https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-ceilometer-useless-service-4e210ddc1c48ac48.yaml#L4

Depends_on: Iea0a46aead14e238fe102d4127b7774dbc2be0e4

Change-Id: Ie8b69e2a0125ea08bb0561991e8e5047bfe47910

This won't fly, unfortunately :( To my best knowledge, only dmidecode gives you RAM size that is *installed*. I.e. what is written in your server's specs. /proc/meminfo gives you RAM minus some reserved space. E.g. on my laptop installed memory is 12 GiB, your method gives 11 GiB."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2017-09-08 23:09:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This won't fly, unfortunately :( To my best knowledge, only
 > dmidecode gives you RAM size that is *installed*. I.e. what is
 > written in your server's specs. /proc/meminfo gives you RAM minus
 > some reserved space. E.g. on my laptop installed memory is 12 GiB,
 > your method gives 11 GiB.

I'll investigate but I don't believe this is true on POWER cpus.  If I'm correct will it be acceptable to fallback to meminfo only on those CPUs?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-10-04 16:06:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'll investigate but I don't believe this is true on POWER cpus.  If I'm correct will it be acceptable to fallback to meminfo only on those CPUs?

Yep, if my assumption is not valid for POWER, we can fall back to whatever the next reliable source is.

Btw, please create a release note for this fix, especially if you want it backported later. And please change Related-Bug to Partial-Bug or Closes-Bug, as it seems a direct fix for it."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2017-10-04 16:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-10-04 16:38:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If we find out that these numbers are different even on POWER, we can do this. Let's move this change to ironic-inspector, and create an option like allow_inaccurate_memory_reporting (with the default of False). If it is True, allow using the "total" field when "physical_mb" is empty. WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-10-05 19:51:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Tony,

thanks for the patch!
So it seems Power8 have no DMI thus no dmidecode would work.
There's also the lshw utility that claims to support, besides other archs, both the dmi-based and ppc-based architectures[1][2]. I checked it is shipped with Fedora. How about using that instead? As a bonus, it's capable of dumping JSON[3]!

Cheers,
milan

[1] http://www.ezix.org/project/wiki/HardwareLiSter
[2] https://github.com/lyonel/lshw
[3] my Fedora VM dump http://paste.openstack.org/show/622790/"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-10-06 08:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nice catch! This gives the correct memory on both my laptop and my Dell desktop:

 sudo lshw -json -quiet | jq '((.children[] | select(.id == "core")).children[] | select(.id == "memory")).size''}, {'account_id': 11929, 'date': '2017-10-10 13:35:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

FYI -  I opened a bug [0] and already have an lshw patch up [1]. I didn't realize lshw can output json though! Will update to use that instead of xml.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent/+bug/1722396
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/501799/"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2017-12-15 02:55:57.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Ie370331df6bb5ef131c5cb60f458877e2a7ad71a is a better solution longer term.

I was hoping to implement something that could be backported to pike but that's a bad idea"}]

[{'created': '2017-11-03 21:30:12.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: properly decode error message from qemu guest agent

Some of error messages from qemu-guest-agent is
localized encoding.
We may get GB2312(Chinese charactors) from qga's error message
from a Chinese version of Windows.

nova didn't cover this senario, we may get errors like:
    UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe6
    in position 138: ordinal not in range(128)

This patch will fix this issue by exception_to_unicode

Closes-bug: #1727643

Change-Id: I3b8bfaec8af0e9b4859dcfe7e35fc5bb26c208dc
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>
(cherry picked from commit 13418faa17e1034db551c8d193a7b08e8b59ef9d)
"}, {'created': '2017-12-14 21:42:44.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: properly decode error message from qemu guest agent

Some of error messages from qemu-guest-agent is
localized encoding.
We may get GB2312(Chinese charactors) from qga's error message
from a Chinese version of Windows.

nova didn't cover this senario, we may get errors like:
    UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe6
    in position 138: ordinal not in range(128)

This patch will fix this issue by exception_to_unicode

Closes-bug: #1727643

Change-Id: I3b8bfaec8af0e9b4859dcfe7e35fc5bb26c208dc
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>
(cherry picked from commit 13418faa17e1034db551c8d193a7b08e8b59ef9d)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: properly decode error message from qemu guest agent

Some of error messages from qemu-guest-agent is
localized encoding.
We may get GB2312(Chinese charactors) from qga's error message
from a Chinese version of Windows.

nova didn't cover this senario, we may get errors like:
    UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe6
    in position 138: ordinal not in range(128)

This patch will fix this issue by exception_to_unicode

Closes-bug: #1727643

Change-Id: I3b8bfaec8af0e9b4859dcfe7e35fc5bb26c208dc
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>
(cherry picked from commit 13418faa17e1034db551c8d193a7b08e8b59ef9d)

commit_message:
Add DSVM jobs to the gate for ironic-tempest-plugin

Previously we only had a pep8 job running for the gate. Add the
following gate jobs:
  - ironic-dsvm-standalone
  - ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant
  - ironic-tempest-dsvm-ironic-inspector

This is to help minimize the risk of introducing code which breaks the
projects which depend on ironic-tempest-plugin.

Change-Id: I144dbfbbc0c49562aafae463c70392c0d289cd52

commit_message:
Add base64decode function to common/utils

Keymaster middleware does some nice input validation on
base64-encoded strings; pull that out somewhere common so
other things (like SLOs with inlined data) can use it, too.

Change-Id: I3436bf3724884fe252c6cb603243c1195f67b701

means that we are no longer having to resolve order. All

will now generate an error, ensuring everything for keystone
is running before handling requests. An exception is for
CLI and CLI tests, as the CLI may directly instantiate
managers and will not lock the registry.

commit_message:
Remove Dependency Injection

Refactors all of keystone's dependency injection to maintain a
single centralized repository of instantiated objects. This
means that we are no longer having to resolve order. All
objects that need to reference the various manager APIs simply
do so via the __getattr__ built into the Manager common object
or the ProviderAPIMixin object.

This is also the first step towards correcting our tests to
where they cannot run "load_backends" multiple times.

This forces any/all managers to properly run super()
as the way to register the api is via __init__.

This eliminates all use of the @dependency.requires and
@dependency.provides decorators, simplifying the objects
all around.

Any instantiations of a Manager after keystone is running
will now generate an error, ensuring everything for keystone
is running before handling requests. An exception is for
CLI and CLI tests, as the CLI may directly instantiate
managers and will not lock the registry.

Change-Id: I4ba17855efd797c0db9f4824936b49e4bff54b6a

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/326326/28/ : FAILURE in 4h 15m 19s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-20 22:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

Have we considered how the marker works across cells like with the migrations pagination change? How do we use the marker to determine which cell to start from for the next page?'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2017-11-21 02:17:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

> Have we considered how the marker works across cells like with the
 > migrations pagination change? 

Yeah, the actions of an instance would be record in different cells(such as cellA or cellB) when the instance migrate from cellA to cellB.

But I'm not sure whether we need add cross cell support in this bp or not.


 > How do we use the marker to determine which cell to start from for the next page?

Sorry, I haven't considered the cross support of instance action yet.

The specifc marker is action req_id, and the cell of the marker maybe is different with instance **current** cell, so, we can't use the instance mapping info either.

So, I think the approach is just like migration stuff, we need do parallel query in every cell to find the marker action."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-27 22:55:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

> So, I think the approach is just like migration stuff, we need do parallel query in every cell to find the marker action.

As noted in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517273/ I'd like to avoid the complexity of the scatter/gather approach for these APIs. Users can't specify sort keys/directions for this API so I think we can find the cell to start paging in using the request_id marker. We'd then have to merge sort the results at the end in the API code.

We don't allow migrations across cells, so we shouldn't have a request_id in more than one cell.

The problem I see is the InstanceAction.get_by_request_id method takes an instance UUID and we don't have an instance. We could potentially do something like _action_get_last_created_by_instance_uuid but instead of using an instance_uuid we use the request_id."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-27 22:56:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

> The problem I see is the InstanceAction.get_by_request_id method takes an instance UUID and we don't have an instance. We could potentially do something like _action_get_last_created_by_instance_uuid but instead of using an instance_uuid we use the request_id.

Nevermind, when listing instance actions we already have the instance uuid since it's part of the request URL path:

GET /servers/{server_id}/os-instance-actions

So we can know which cell we're in based on the server_id and using the instance mappings table, and from there we can use the request_id marker for page within that cell for that given instance."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-27 23:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

commit_message:
Add pagination and changes-since for instance-actions

This patch adds pagination support and changes-since filter
for os-instance-actions API.

Users can now use 'limit' and 'marker' to perform paginate
query of instance action list. Users can also filter the
results according to the actions' updated time.

Co-Authored-By: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com>

Implement: blueprint pagination-add-changes-since-for-instance-action-list

Change-Id: I1a1b39803e8d0449f21d2ab5ef96d4060e638aa8

commit_message:
qemu-img do not use cache=none if no O_DIRECT support

If /var/lib/nova/instances is mounted on a filesystem like tmpfs that
doesn't have support for O_DIRECT, "qemu-img convert" currently crashes
because it's unconditionally using the "-t none" flag.

This patch therefore:
- moves the _supports_direct_io() function out of the libvirt driver,
from nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py to nova/utils.py and makes it public.
- uses that function to decide to use -t none or -t writethrough when
converting images with qemu-img.

Closes-Bug: #1734784

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ifb47de00abf3f83442ca5264fbc24885df924a19

commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Collect the pip.conf configuration file

It's helpful to know how the glocal pip.conf configuration file is
constructed so add it to the list of files we collect at the end of
each job.

Change-Id: I70e2b9b20c3a92c436f37c086476c41b97ab3a55

In the 75ad9983f4fa1142805860fbd5a567dfedadcf21 commit that introduce that you said

'This also changes the container create and destroy tasks to be done
 in serial. This is being done due to potential control path issues.'

Since we are operating on localhost the 'serial: 1' shouldn't have been there from the beginning right?"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-24 16:14:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Agreed with Markos - happy for this to go in, but the original reason does not seem to have been addressed in this review's commit message."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-25 04:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-25 04:48:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I can't say for certain that the control path issue we experienced before are no longer a problem however I do know we've done quite a bit elsewhere to ensure we no longer have those issues. Additionally we build the containers in parallel within the integrated repo so I can say we've not seen these types of problems there, at least not for a long time. All that said, I think the speed increase in the role tests is work the try."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-27 09:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Remove the serialization in tests

The lxc container create process were running in serial as it sets up
the test environment. Being this is setting up a test environment
there's no need for it to be executed in serial. The original reason
these container creates were running in serial was due to SSH issues
however the integrated repo has been creating containers in parallel for
sometime now so it is believed the original control path issues have
been resolved.

Change-Id: I59d563549b288e634338474aed45011e94b85c47
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Added MySQL connection SSL support

MySQL SSL connections allowed.
When glance_galera_use_ssl is True Glance sets up encrypted connection
to the database using either self-signed or user-provided CA certificate.

Change-Id: Ib08c3c76508226d52e89b1839a6b07d20c1f300c
Partial-Bug: #1667789

commit_message:
Added MySQL connection SSL support.

MySQL SSL connections allowed.
When cinder_galera_use_ssl is True Cinder sets up encrypted connection
to the database using either self-signed or user-provided CA certificate.

Partial-Bug: #1667789

commit_message:
Only query BDMs once in API during rebuild

We were unnecessarily looking up BDMs from the database
more than once during rebuild in the API. This makes that
a single read.

Change-Id: Iab929210d11336d09d9eef14ff6904e630ba195a
(cherry picked from commit 718e5af486c2e4011a4738285deac945993d5d5f)
(cherry picked from commit 6c1a0889bc124be327324466b48f2246a0cf0ad1)

commit_message:
Use the tempest plugin from openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin

Use the tempest plugin from openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin as we
have moved the tempest code there. Soon the tempest code will be
deleted from openstack/ironic.

Hmm, we used to have something to make this happen but I guess it got lost in a bunch of the changes.'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-12-14 14:59:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Hmm, we used to have something to make this happen but I guess it
 > got lost in a bunch of the changes.

It was happening through a playbook var, that's being removed here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527778/

The problem with overriding there was that the self-signed certs generated in the galera_server role wouldn't be usable. The common name should be the VIP, not 127.0.0.1

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L189

Everything should work correctly with the existing group var for galera_address: internal_vip_address."}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-12-14 17:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-12-14 17:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-12-14 17:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Always template a localhost config when server

If the galera_client role is templating its config file on a galera
server host it should always use a localhost address.

Change-Id: I468b171c1e72697ea6450fe08aa0acb3faf91201

[{'created': '2017-12-14 19:43:20.000000000', 'message': '[Gate fix] Change policy for create_port/update_port:fixed_ips

This commit fixes the policies used by the tests:

  * test_create_port_fixed_ips
  * test_update_port_fixed_ips

To validate the following policy actions instead:

  * create_port:fixed_ips:ip_address
  * update_port:fixed_ips:ip_address

This change is necessary because Neutron recently added more specific
policy enforcement for these actions in:

  I1046f6b13e68b1e274cc8f62f5b30aa5f8d71cdc

Also renames the test names to convey the more specific policy
name.

Change-Id: If123e20b10614e8e31ecaecf74e4beda6b575e40
'}]
commit_message:
[Gate fix] Change policy for create_port/update_port:fixed_ips

This commit fixes the policies used by the tests:

  * test_create_port_fixed_ips
  * test_update_port_fixed_ips

To validate the following policy actions instead:

  * create_port:fixed_ips:ip_address
  * update_port:fixed_ips:ip_address

This change is necessary because Neutron recently added more specific
policy enforcement for these actions in:

  I1046f6b13e68b1e274cc8f62f5b30aa5f8d71cdc

Also renames the test names to convey the more specific policy
name.

Change-Id: If123e20b10614e8e31ecaecf74e4beda6b575e40

commit_message:
Link the current deployed release on a leapfrog

Existing code assumes starting point of KILO_RELEASE.
This change allows other releases to be the starting
point before the migrations occur.

Change-Id: Idb7d2981b37e653c9e92a9e41e4bf54b17aef1f5

subject: Add python-magic to requirements.
messages:
[{'account_id': 15007, 'date': '2017-12-02 20:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15007, 'date': '2017-12-02 21:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15007, 'date': '2017-12-02 21:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15007, 'date': '2017-12-03 07:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks like a decent addition to me.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2017-12-05 01:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

seems updated, having tests, I am concerned about https://travis-ci.org/ahupp/python-magic though'}, {'account_id': 15007, 'date': '2017-12-05 05:51:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

To my understanding not everything that hits their Travis CI is released as such. I believe only items which are tagged as a release are released to PyPi, there seems to be discipline when tagging releases that all tests pass when reviewing the Travis history.'}, {'account_id': 15007, 'date': '2017-12-12 20:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2017-12-13 10:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

OK for me if needed. python-magic is a python binding for libmagic1, so this imply a delegated dependency to a C library. It is mostly installed in all distributions, but I wonder if is not better to use something like python-filetype that do not have such C dependency (AFAIK)'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2017-12-13 18:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-12-14 14:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15007, 'date': '2017-12-14 14:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 20:57:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add python-magic to requirements.

- Actively Maintained?
  Yes, this is a very popular Python package and it's maintainer
  Adam Hupp is very active within the project.

- Good code?
  Looks pretty good to me, currently tested via Travis and the
  tox coverage is very comprehensive.

- Python 3 compatable?
  Yes, compatible with Python 2.7 and 3.

- License?
  MIT

- Packaged as part of targetted distros?
  Ubuntu - Yes
  Fedora - Yes

- Is the functionality already covered?
  This package extends some functionality already provided within
  the Python built ins. The Python built in "magic" simply uses
  a files extension to determine MIME type (not very comprehensive)
  however python-magic wraps libmagic and provides a much better
  method of identifying a files MIME type by using a bunch of
  signatures which are compared to parts of the file, and hence
  is much likely to return an accurate result.

- Which project is this for?
  This is intended to be used as part of the Nemesis project which
  aims to provide a file information and intelligence API for the
  OpenStack ecosystem. However I can imagine this would be useful
  for any project which needs to identify the type of a file with
  some accuracy.

Change-Id: I1382d1cd22275b03e3f0c6aff941d1c207e37faa
