commit_message:
determine influxdb version on each request if required

When determining influxdb version, the code relies on results of
SHOW DIAGNOSTICS. It is unknown when version banner appeared in
the output of the query, so in case we can't find it there the
version is assumed to be < 0.10.

However, it is incorrect to assume that any error means that
the version is < 0.10. Sometimes error means that influxdb is not
ready to serve connections yet. Ignoring these errors leads to
incorrect state of the application.

Try determining version of influxdb on application startup.
If it fails, retry the attempt on each request.

Change-Id: I813201e0410150cb9c81117232ac3986423e7503
Story: 2001313
Task: 5867
(cherry picked from commit 6e13c33c83a3c3cdfe7842a7a72b2bc4ba5ab329)

The 'galera_ssl_server' variable has been updated to use the default OSA
galera group, galera_all, and the default value of 'galera_ssl_ca_cert'
has been updated to match the galera_server role.

Since the slurp task that checks for an existing CA cert file is set to
never fail, the debug message should check if any content was found. The

default value from the galera_server role and used by the
'galera_ssl_ca_cert' variable to find a galera node within the inventory
to attempt to pull cert files from.

Since the slurp task that checks for an existing CA cert file is set to
never fail, the debug message should check if any content was found. The
changed_when can also be removed since slurp tasks only return 'ok'
when a file is found.

Change-Id: I95cc994df5118fce7ce588fc0bff979bc283a6f3
"}, {'created': '2017-12-13 16:41:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix SSL cert distribution tasks

'galera_ssl_ca_cert' variable to find a galera node within the inventory
to attempt to pull cert files from.

Since the slurp task that checks for an existing CA cert file is set to
never fail, the debug message should check if any content was found. The
changed_when can also be removed since slurp tasks only return 'ok'

Change-Id: I95cc994df5118fce7ce588fc0bff979bc283a6f3
"}, {'created': '2017-12-13 23:12:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix SSL cert distribution tasks

The 'galera_cluster_members' variable has been added, matching the
default value from the galera_server role and used by the
'galera_ssl_ca_cert' variable to find a galera node within the inventory
to attempt to pull cert files from.

Since the slurp task that checks for an existing CA cert file is set to
never fail, the debug message should check if any content was found. The
changed_when can also be removed since slurp tasks only return 'ok'
when a file is found.

The task copying an existing cert from a server was using a 'src'
argument where it should be 'dest'.

Change-Id: I95cc994df5118fce7ce588fc0bff979bc283a6f3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix SSL cert distribution tasks

The 'galera_cluster_members' variable has been added, matching the
default value from the galera_server role and used by the
'galera_ssl_ca_cert' variable to find a galera node within the inventory
to attempt to pull cert files from.

Since the slurp task that checks for an existing CA cert file is set to
never fail, the debug message should check if any content was found. The
changed_when can also be removed since slurp tasks only return 'ok'
when a file is found.

The task copying an existing cert from a server was using a 'src'
argument where it should be 'dest'.

Change-Id: I95cc994df5118fce7ce588fc0bff979bc283a6f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-12 20:45:30.000000000', 'message': "Provide the option to set the the client version

This change allows the deployer to set the client lib when deploying on
Uubntu 16.04 This was limited to only 16.04 because ONLY hammer will
work on 14.04.

Additionally the apt update task in teh preinstall task file is buggy
which will result in a failed deployment. To ensure we're running into
issues caused by skipped tasks the conditions limiting the apt-update
option has been removed.

Change-Id: I981bf80790e49d01163e347d820906d2aab76394
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Provide the option to set the the client version

This change allows the deployer to set the client lib when deploying on
Uubntu 16.04 This was limited to only 16.04 because ONLY hammer will
work on 14.04.

Additionally the apt update task in teh preinstall task file is buggy
which will result in a failed deployment. To ensure we're running into
issues caused by skipped tasks the conditions limiting the apt-update
option has been removed.

Change-Id: I981bf80790e49d01163e347d820906d2aab76394
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix functional tests

The patch [0] in Neuton makes 'subnet_id' and 'floating_ip_address'
mandatory when creating a floation IP. This patch is just adapting our
functional tests to account for that.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521707/

Change-Id: I691e243c813b32ce62ac8c3f8ead299042a6dea9

commit_message:
Fix canal.yml version from 1.6 to 1.7

canal-node doesn't work correctly when using canal.yml v1.6. It occcurs
following error:

  Failed to ensure ThirdPartyResources exist: resource does not exist

This commit updates the version from 1.6 to 1.7.

Change-Id: Ie408080b24ae74b00dc6a40235eefaaf920f5009

commit_message:
Fix subcommand for kubectl

Current required version(>=1.8.0) of kubectl has 'apply' command.  This
commit replaces from 'update' to 'apply' and adds '--validate=false' to
avoid an error.

Change-Id: I37e49dcade3577efacd89e12abd132303564cb7c
Closes-Bug: #1737389

commit_message:
Add config option for 'kubelet' and 'kubeadm' init

This commit adds an option KUBELET_EXTRA_ARGS=--fail-swap-on=false for
kubelet and --skip-preflight-checks for kubeadm init.

Change-Id: Iae865c03255f7659aa9c5744780502064de92616
Closes-Bug: #1737770

commit_message:
Trivial-Fix: Add packages installation for Ubuntu

This commit adds an installation for ansible, python-pip and python-dev
which OS is Ubuntu.  In addition, it fixes a source directory for
copying kolla-ansible config file.

Change-Id: I6cfa4e900b65cfe75aad14e3e6ca3a121f00cff7

[{'created': '2017-12-07 09:29:36.000000000', 'message': 'scripts: install-deps.sh: Ensure distros have package metadata available

Before trying to install any packages for the tests, we should ensure

'}]
commit_message:
scripts: install-deps.sh: Ensure distros have package metadata available

Before trying to install any packages for the tests, we should ensure
that the package metadata is updated otherwise some packges may be
reported as missing.

Change-Id: Idc2033eee917b3024e392712aec9feb7611c097a

commit_message:
Handle Pike changes for Neutron

- Updated default quotas to match Neutron upstream.
- Renamed configuration options to match upstream
- Removed deprecations

Change-Id: I2e5a2ad84fdaa0caee81ee2b63eb9897465d6345

commit_message:
Add [designate] section in neutron.conf

If neutron_designate_enabled variable is true,
this will enable the [designate] section and all needed configuration.

Change-Id: I82469a1de6a7ebce8ca2f568c1bb8125bbc57965
Closes-Bug: 1687594

commit_message:
Disable Citycloud kna1

Citycloud has requested that we stop using the kna1 region for a period
of 2 months (until February 14, 2018) to aid ongoing upgrades and
maintenance work in that region.

Change-Id: Ib0c6af20a78f48ca25b8ffd256f6aecce3ec25b3

commit_message:
Incremented chefdk to 2.3.4

- incremented chefdk release to 2.3.4
- populated some NODEPOOL_* macros for future use

Implements blueprint modern-chef

commit_message:
Make FreeIPA supplemental node DNS server configureable

DNS server was previously hardcoded. Users may now customize the DNS
server set on the FreeIPA supplmental node prior to deployment.

Change-Id: I1669c323862a2634d997b08c630c74e7281d999b
Closes-bug: 1712081

for cells v2, bug triage, and the metadata service.

commit_message:
doc: link in some Sydney summit content

This adds some links to talks from the Sydney summit to the docs
for cells v2, bug triage, and the metadata service.

While adding a "References" section to the metadata docs, I figured
it was also useful to link to a blog post from mikal about vendordata
since it also includes code samples.

Change-Id: Ifc47a5472db37f5526004d2e00751365a026975a

add min version info for PUT /resource_classes/name one?'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-11-21 11:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> add min version info for PUT /resource_classes/name one?

IMO, it is unnecessary.
"PUT /resource_classes/{name}" are described twice.
The one is microversion 1.2-1.6, the other is 1.7 or later.
I added 'Location' parameter in the latter.
Users can understand that 'Location' parameter is enabled in microversion 1.7 or later without minimum version description.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-11-21 16:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
[placement] Add 'Location' parameters in API ref

The 'Location' parameters are missing in the follwoing APIs of
Placement API reference. So add them.

* POST /resource_providers
* POST /resource_classes
* PUT /resource_classes/{name} (microversion 1.7-)
* PUT /traits/{name}

Change-Id: Ieed5cb7d4697472ab46b2e80d6d2df68098c5631
Closes-Bug: #1733329

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 15:36:23.000000000', 'message': "[placement] add name to resource provider create error

When a resource provider is created an ObjectActionError can
happen. The API handler for POST /resource_provider catches
this and sends out an error response. Prior to this change the
response only identified the resource provider by uuid. Since
it is possible to create a resource provider by only providing
a name, this error response may not be super useful.

This change adds the name of the proposed resource provider to
the message, to make sure things are clear.

However, it's worth noting that at the current time most
situations which would cause an ObjectActionError are not
possible from the API code path: they are caught by the
JSONSchema validation. The one clear path that is not caught,
and thus is the place where a validation of the response has
been done in a gabbit, is when a resource provider tries to
set its parent uuid to its own uuid. In order for the caller
to do this, the caller has to know its own uuid, so the
ambiguity problem is moot.

As we might make additional changes in the future, adding
the name seems the most flexible thing to do, so here it
is.

Change-Id: I7fee5344fc7cb2e4ba3f46e192ba0122edeb0605
Closes-Bug: #1735405
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] add name to resource provider create error

When a resource provider is created an ObjectActionError can
happen. The API handler for POST /resource_provider catches
this and sends out an error response. Prior to this change the
response only identified the resource provider by uuid. Since
it is possible to create a resource provider by only providing
a name, this error response may not be super useful.

This change adds the name of the proposed resource provider to
the message, to make sure things are clear.

However, it's worth noting that at the current time most
situations which would cause an ObjectActionError are not
possible from the API code path: they are caught by the
JSONSchema validation. The one clear path that is not caught,
and thus is the place where a validation of the response has
been done in a gabbit, is when a resource provider tries to
set its parent uuid to its own uuid. In order for the caller
to do this, the caller has to know its own uuid, so the
ambiguity problem is moot.

As we might make additional changes in the future, adding
the name seems the most flexible thing to do, so here it
is.

Change-Id: I7fee5344fc7cb2e4ba3f46e192ba0122edeb0605
Closes-Bug: #1735405

commit_message:
Remove Cinder UID from CephX keyrings' ACLs

Like for the other OpenStack services, ACLs are managed by the puppet
module.

Depends-On: I0c1bc3d2362c6500b1a515d99f641f8c1468754a
Change-Id: I48f0711622bfc55054de46b9fb4fd765b7e4df74
Related-Bug: #1734134

commit_message:
Set restrictive file permissions on Ceph keyrings for non-containerized deployment

Pass mode parameter 0600 and user and group ownership to puppet-ceph for
Ceph openstack client keyrings during non-containerized deployment.

Author:    Keith Schincke <kschinck@redhat.com>
Co-Author:    John Fulton <fulton@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iccb24f5c2ee639ad2bc0869a37cec305f32b9fd1
Depends-On: I0c1bc3d2362c6500b1a515d99f641f8c1468754a

commit_message:
Enable set_ctlplane_dns in ipa.yml environment

This shouldn't mean any tangible change, it's just a preparation for a
commit that introduces this variable into
quickstart-extras (I83017b0598ce2321c99fe1bcc142c9127a932a48), so that
it's controlled by its own variable rather than being tied to the TLS
scenario.

Change-Id: I9e9d0e50b7b6dfe1ff57b14780a8b2103af12bc0

[{'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-12-05 15:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14273, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:23:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This seems like it will work though I don't like modifying the forked code in this manner.  I don't have any better alternative in this case that isn't even uglier since we're having to clear out internal structures in the producer."}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-12-05 20:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-12-05 20:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I was able to make the change in the kafka producer wrapper that is not part of the forked kafka library.'}, {'account_id': 14273, 'date': '2017-12-05 22:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2419, 'date': '2017-12-06 14:00:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Wouldn't the Agent buffer the http request that failed try to send it again on the next batch.

In addition, if a Kafka container is re-starting, couldn't that take longer than one second to re-start, therefore, retrying once could still not be long enough."}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-12-06 14:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@roland, Please look at the Story. It has the explanation of what I am fixing in this case'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2017-12-06 18:32:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Looks good.  I'm no expert on kafka, so I'm curious if the metadata is wiped does it get regenerated on the second try or is the metadata just irrelevant to the publish?"}, {'account_id': 14273, 'date': '2017-12-06 18:54:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The metadata should be regenerated when it attempts to reconnect to the broker.  In this case, where a Kubernetes pod restarts, the DNS name we're using still works to reconnect but the metadata is invalid."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:10:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14517, 'date': '2017-12-08 23:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-11 12:30:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

The other two tasks in the story can be deleted, right?'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-12-11 19:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-12-11 19:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14273, 'date': '2017-12-11 19:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-12-11 19:18:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Joseph Davis, the metadata gets fetched on the retry of the publish so it knows which Kafka server to use for sending the message'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-12 12:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-12 12:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Code looks good to me.

Not directly related: when trying to test in local vagrant environment, several tempest tests fail when publishing to 'events' topic with "Message queue service unavailable". Any ideas?
Btw. this change does not influence that behavior.'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2017-12-12 15:30:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Witold I have seen an issue where the Kafka server closes idle connections after a 10 minutes or so. Then, the first write to a kafka topic fails but the following ones succeed. This will happen once per worker. Maybe you are seeing that? I haven't seen that problem, though, in Kubernetes."}, {'account_id': 14517, 'date': '2017-12-12 17:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14273, 'date': '2017-12-12 17:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-14 12:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}]

[{'created': '2017-12-05 15:54:06.000000000', 'message': 'Retry publish once on failures

Clear the topic metadata in case the IP Addresses have changed.
This can be common when Monasca is run in Kubernetes and the
Kafka pod is restarted.

This changes the actual Kafka library code that was saved into
this repo. It might be possible to use newer code, but that
would introduce lots of other changes so making the simplest
fix here.

Change-Id: If48971c40883b5be10adec947562cdda7e82d77c

commit_message:
Retry publish once on failures

On failure to publish, clear the topic metadata then retry, in
case the IP Addresses have changed.  This can occur when
Monasca is run in Kubernetes and the Kafka pod is restarted.
Restarting the Kafka pod can happen often enough the
API should be able handle it without losing a message.

Change-Id: If48971c40883b5be10adec947562cdda7e82d77c
Story: 2001386
Task: 5963

commit_message:
Bump haproxy_exporter version from v0.7.1 to v0.8.0

Prometheus release v0.8.0 version haproxy_exporter 3 months ago.
All the parameters prefix change from "-" to "--", it's good to
align with it.

Closes-Bug: #1736322

Change-Id: I9cc80769443317cb37911d1c4835e1a99a259c7e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 11:07:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix include action DEPRECATION WARNING (Ansible >2.4)

- The include action was too confusing, dealing with both plays and tasks,
  being both dynamic and static. This module will be removed in version 2.8. As
  alternatives use include_tasks, import_playbook, import_tasks.

Change-Id: Id0bf75346956a385fc89fcd3b17c70937fe9c4b7
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix include action DEPRECATION WARNING (Ansible >2.4)

- The include action was too confusing, dealing with both plays and tasks,
  being both dynamic and static. This module will be removed in version 2.8. As
  alternatives use include_tasks, import_playbook, import_tasks.

Change-Id: Id0bf75346956a385fc89fcd3b17c70937fe9c4b7
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[atomic actions] Add reset method

ContextManager uses the same instances of contexts (which are inhertors
of ActionTimerMixin) for both setup and cleanup methods. In terms of
storing stats for contexts, it will make cleanup stats include the stats
of setup method as well. It is wrong behavior and it is a case for
extending ActionTimerMixin interface with a method to reset all saved
atomic actions.

Change-Id: I15e9b8aa446c7746fbee1b62e2d62226de4321a8

[{'created': '2017-12-05 10:42:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix crontab errors on CentOS/SUSE

CentOS comes with a default empty crontab file that is fine for
most deployers. It also lacks the `--report` option for `run-parts`
that Ubuntu has.

SUSE doesn't have run-parts at all.

This causes the server administrator to receive emails with errors
from cron on a regular basis. This patch limits the crontab
deployment to Ubuntu only and skips CentOS/SUSE hosts.

commit_message:
Fix crontab errors on CentOS/SUSE

CentOS comes with a default empty crontab file that is fine for
most deployers. It also lacks the `--report` option for `run-parts`
that Ubuntu has.

SUSE doesn't have run-parts at all.

This causes the server administrator to receive emails with errors
from cron on a regular basis. This patch limits the crontab
deployment to Ubuntu only and skips CentOS/SUSE hosts.

Closes-Bug: 1732762
Change-Id: Iba714e1e20e1a27b1a5bb58a714dee3916faba8f
(cherry picked from commit c4d12eba1b5b6c27b318b84a58a442ee80aa9db0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 13:03:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix codec error when format=csv

The Py2 version of the csv module cannot accept unicode text. In Py2
we replaced the csv module with the unicodecsv module which encodes
unicode text prior to calling the standard Py2 csv module. Thus when
the cvs formatted output is emitted on stdout it is presented as a
encoded byte stream. But stdout has been replaced with a StreamWriter
which encodes to the desired encoding. The problem is the StreamWriter
attempts to encode all objects passed to it's write function,
including str objects. Instead it should only encode unicode text objects
and allow bytes to pass through unmodified.

This patch adds an override of the codecs.getwriter function which
only encodes unicode text objects. In addtion we pass the encoding
value obtained from the stream to the unicodecsv writer.

The patch fixes the codec error when outputing csv formated text that
contains a non-ASCII character. The unicodecsv implmentation will emit
byte encoded str objects to the stream. When the core StreamWriter
attempts to encode a str object Python will first promote the str
object to a unicode object. The promotion of str to unicode requires
the str bytes to be decoded. However the encoding associated with the
str object is not known therefore Python applies the default-encoding
which is ASCII. In the case where the str object contains utf-8
encoded non-ASCII characters a decoding error is raised. By not
attempting to encode a byte stream we avoid this error.

A more complete discussion of the above issues can be found here:

https://github.com/fedora-infra/kitchen/blob/develop/kitchen2/docs/unicode-frustrations.rst#frustration-4-now-it-doesnt-take-byte-strings

Change-Id: I22b5ad8bf0e227ec75a2a36986f0487191f7cbc2
Closes-Bug: 1720115
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c61cc30060ca56257ca3504153578e02e68e7f0a)
"}, {'created': '2017-12-06 13:53:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix codec error when format=csv

The Py2 version of the csv module cannot accept unicode text. In Py2
we replaced the csv module with the unicodecsv module which encodes
unicode text prior to calling the standard Py2 csv module. Thus when
the cvs formatted output is emitted on stdout it is presented as a
encoded byte stream. But stdout has been replaced with a StreamWriter
which encodes to the desired encoding. The problem is the StreamWriter
attempts to encode all objects passed to it's write function,
including str objects. Instead it should only encode unicode text objects
and allow bytes to pass through unmodified.

This patch adds an override of the codecs.getwriter function which
only encodes unicode text objects. In addtion we pass the encoding
value obtained from the stream to the unicodecsv writer.

The patch fixes the codec error when outputing csv formated text that
contains a non-ASCII character. The unicodecsv implmentation will emit
byte encoded str objects to the stream. When the core StreamWriter
attempts to encode a str object Python will first promote the str
object to a unicode object. The promotion of str to unicode requires
the str bytes to be decoded. However the encoding associated with the
str object is not known therefore Python applies the default-encoding
which is ASCII. In the case where the str object contains utf-8
encoded non-ASCII characters a decoding error is raised. By not
attempting to encode a byte stream we avoid this error.

A more complete discussion of the above issues can be found here:

https://github.com/fedora-infra/kitchen/blob/develop/kitchen2/docs/unicode-frustrations.rst#frustration-4-now-it-doesnt-take-byte-strings

Change-Id: I22b5ad8bf0e227ec75a2a36986f0487191f7cbc2
Closes-Bug: 1720115
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c61cc30060ca56257ca3504153578e02e68e7f0a)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix codec error when format=csv

The Py2 version of the csv module cannot accept unicode text. In Py2
we replaced the csv module with the unicodecsv module which encodes
unicode text prior to calling the standard Py2 csv module. Thus when
the cvs formatted output is emitted on stdout it is presented as a
encoded byte stream. But stdout has been replaced with a StreamWriter
which encodes to the desired encoding. The problem is the StreamWriter
attempts to encode all objects passed to it's write function,
including str objects. Instead it should only encode unicode text objects
and allow bytes to pass through unmodified.

This patch adds an override of the codecs.getwriter function which
only encodes unicode text objects. In addtion we pass the encoding
value obtained from the stream to the unicodecsv writer.

The patch fixes the codec error when outputing csv formated text that
contains a non-ASCII character. The unicodecsv implmentation will emit
byte encoded str objects to the stream. When the core StreamWriter
attempts to encode a str object Python will first promote the str
object to a unicode object. The promotion of str to unicode requires
the str bytes to be decoded. However the encoding associated with the
str object is not known therefore Python applies the default-encoding
which is ASCII. In the case where the str object contains utf-8
encoded non-ASCII characters a decoding error is raised. By not
attempting to encode a byte stream we avoid this error.

A more complete discussion of the above issues can be found here:

https://github.com/fedora-infra/kitchen/blob/develop/kitchen2/docs/unicode-frustrations.rst#frustration-4-now-it-doesnt-take-byte-strings

Change-Id: I22b5ad8bf0e227ec75a2a36986f0487191f7cbc2
Closes-Bug: 1720115
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c61cc30060ca56257ca3504153578e02e68e7f0a)

commit_message:
Change config option to 'ironic_inspector' and False by default

Change the config option which enables the ironic inspector tests to
'ironic_inspector'. When trying to use 'ironic-inspector = False' it
did not work. Using 'ironic_inspector = False' did work. So to remove
future confusion change the option name to 'ironic_inspector'

Also change the default to False, otherwise the tests are running on
non-inspector test runs and failing. Working around it is difficult
because of the ironic grenade jobs. So change it to default to False.

Change-Id: Ic1d9fbdb1505662ef499229f700dffb719993a90

[{'created': '2017-12-05 15:44:12.000000000', 'message': "Add regression test for rebuilding a volume-backed server

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes rebuild
check to see if the user is rebuilding an instance with a new
image and if so, to run the scheduler filters again since the
new image might not work with the current host for the instance,
and we rebuild to the same host that the instance is already
running on.

The problem is the instance.image_ref attribute is not set for
a volume-backed (boot-from-volume) instance, so the conditional
in the rebuild() method is always True, which means we always run
through the scheduler for volume-backed instances during rebuild,
even if the image in the root disk isn't changing.

This adds a functional regression test to recreate the bug.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/fixtures.py

NOTE(mriedem): The CinderFixture conflict is due to not having
1928ec5606491de95abba8791b1d7b888690dd3c in Ocata. However, this
change needs the part of that patch to the CinderFixture to work,
so it's added here.

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test needed to change slightly to
use the PlacementFixture and disable the DiskFilter.

Change-Id: If79c554b46c44a7f70f8367426e7da362d7234c8
Related-Bug: #1732947
(cherry picked from commit a4eebd5de7ef4b63082536718ba7b993a66d47e7)
(cherry picked from commit c7991653a4e7cbb86656e6ba7579a86236801567)
"}]
commit_message:
Add regression test for rebuilding a volume-backed server

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes rebuild
check to see if the user is rebuilding an instance with a new
image and if so, to run the scheduler filters again since the
new image might not work with the current host for the instance,
and we rebuild to the same host that the instance is already
running on.

The problem is the instance.image_ref attribute is not set for
a volume-backed (boot-from-volume) instance, so the conditional
in the rebuild() method is always True, which means we always run
through the scheduler for volume-backed instances during rebuild,
even if the image in the root disk isn't changing.

This adds a functional regression test to recreate the bug.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/fixtures.py

1928ec5606491de95abba8791b1d7b888690dd3c in Ocata. However, this
change needs the part of that patch to the CinderFixture to work,
so it's added here.

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test needed to change slightly to
use the PlacementFixture and disable the DiskFilter.

commit_message:
Set the base set of services

Use the test-matrix role from devstack-gate to define a base set of
services to be enabled for the controller and compute nodes.

Extend the local conf module to handle the base set of services.

Since the test-matrix defines services for primary and subnode nodes, we
need a multinode job to test that this works. Add a new host group
called subnode that includes the non-controller hosts. Add a new job
that runs devstack on a two nodes environment.

Using service from the test matrix enables swift in the gate, so we need
to set SWIFT_HASH for devstack to work.

Depends-on: Ie36ba0cd7cfcd450b75000a76a64d856f2a83eba
Depends-on: Id9ad3be4be25e699f77d6b5a252f046ce8234f45
Change-Id: I379abf482c89122533324e64fefbff3d5a618a89

commit_message:
ceilometer: ensure gnocchi is started for upgrade

We currently retry during 50 seconds, but with real data that can be not
enough to wait that gnocchi-upgrade is done and all puppet stuffs for
gnocchi finished. This change adds a dependency to gnocchi service.

We keep the retry code, in case of another thing restart httpd somewhere
else.

Change-Id: I71369e5c160474cd69fce4f87fce66a9bcd39b2a

subject: Relax locking of filter drivers sync method
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 13636, 'name': 'aarefiev', 'email': 'aarefiev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aarefiev'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 18653, 'name': 'Milan Kovik', 'email': 'mkovacik@redhat.com', 'username': 'dparalen'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-12-13 15:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-12-13 15:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Folks, please, take a look and let me know whether this makes sense to you.

Cheers,
milan'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2017-12-13 15:32:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for this Milan. I can see some merit in not blocking the periodic sync - if it can't acquire the lock then it means that a sync is currently happening. I guess to take this further, we might not need to sync if we have done so recently, within some time window.

I don't think we can remove the blocking behaviour for non-periodic syncs - we need to ensure the PXE filter is configured correctly prior to booting a node for inspection, and after processing has completed (before setting the inspection status to finished)."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2017-12-13 15:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Perhaps we could add an argument to the sync method to request non-blocking behaviour?'}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-12-13 19:19:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Hey Mark,

thanks for the review!
I guess you're right: an ongoing sync won't guarantee the node in question is going to be whitelisted for a boot (or blacklisted for a finish).

Moreover, to solve your performance issue on the POST@/v1/continue endpoint, we'd have to run the werkzeug server threaded too (main: Flask(__name__).run(threaded=True)); maybe that's a better way to achieve higher throughput.

The periodic sync is but a k+1 issue in your case (1x each 30s racing with the other 30 requests) so won't help too much to skip that one in case another sync is already in progress.

I shall sleep on it yet but this patch seems like an abandon candidate

Cheers,
milan"}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-12-13 19:26:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I guess you're right: an ongoing sync won't guarantee the node in question is going to be whitelisted for a boot (or blacklisted for a finish).

... is going to be white-/black-listed soon enough for a boot/finish"}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-12-14 10:42:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mark,

>>> I don't think we can remove the blocking behaviour for non-periodic 
>>> syncs - we need to ensure the PXE filter is configured correctly 
>>> prior to booting a node for inspection, and after processing has
>>> completed (before setting the inspection status to finished).

>> I guess you're right: an ongoing sync won't guarantee the node in question is going to be 
>> whitelisted for a boot (or blacklisted for a finish).

> ... is going to be white-/black-listed soon enough for a boot/finish

I've been trying hard to come up with a reason to keep this patch, I see it's not making the situation any better for anyone :D

Cheers,
milan"}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-12-14 10:43:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-13 15:00:23.000000000', 'message': 'Relax locking of filter drivers sync method

The sync method turns out to be a signifficant bottleneck esp. with
iptables once couple of dozens of ports need blacklisting.

This patch relaxes the driver.sync() locking to non-blocking such that if
a lock acquire failed, the driver.sync() call is going to be skipped and
will be retried during next periodic filter sync or next explicit filter
sync (by either the introspect() or the process() function).

Change-Id: I3b0702ad5660201b00e872fd69763331c61bc8d0
Closes-Bug: #1737947
'}]
commit_message:
Relax locking of filter drivers sync method

The sync method turns out to be a signifficant bottleneck esp. with
iptables once couple of dozens of ports need blacklisting.

This patch relaxes the driver.sync() locking to non-blocking such that if
a lock acquire failed, the driver.sync() call is going to be skipped and
will be retried during next periodic filter sync or next explicit filter
sync (by either the introspect() or the process() function).

Change-Id: I3b0702ad5660201b00e872fd69763331c61bc8d0
Closes-Bug: #1737947

commit_message:
Fix floatingip tests that were broken by neutron

Floating IP tests were broken by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521707/
as the notation of attribute access was modified from 'get' notation to
'[]' notation, so if we do not set the attributes, an exception is
thrown and fails the test.
Just added the relevant attributes with 'None' value.

Change-Id: Ifda93cf8a4c5ebd49e4d9da2be0974d83564f5dd

Add missing parameters for neutron lbaas-octavia connection details

In order to make octavia function we need to configure the right
parameters in neutron.conf file. hence we should pass all the
required parameters.

Change-Id: I7a8586fe81da22bd8bf793c54ca205a212fa5eb8

subject: Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 09:12:36.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I6b3756fd9364182cc39b95670d050627b042ac32
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I6b3756fd9364182cc39b95670d050627b042ac32

[{'created': '2017-12-08 18:33:52.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude keystonemiddleware 4.19.0

keystonemiddleware 4.19.0 introduced a dependency on memcache and
pulled in dogpile.cache and oslo.cache, causing gate failures.
Future versions of keystonemiddleware should be fixed by
commit 0c5070a035ca2eea200c5a7ab6b40375498463ac in that repo.

Note that in Queens and beyond the requirement for keystonemiddleware
has been removed from Ceilometer, so this fix cannot be placed on
the master branch.

Change-Id: Ibea7049f9fca0783b9ecf54a75bccbc27aef2187
'}, {'created': '2017-12-12 17:59:30.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude keystonemiddleware 4.19.0, force gnocchi install in devstack

Change-Id: Ibea7049f9fca0783b9ecf54a75bccbc27aef2187

commit_message:
Exclude keystonemiddleware 4.19.0, force gnocchi install in devstack

keystonemiddleware 4.19.0 introduced a dependency on memcache and
pulled in dogpile.cache and oslo.cache, causing gate failures.
Future versions of keystonemiddleware should be fixed by
commit 0c5070a035ca2eea200c5a7ab6b40375498463ac in that repo.

Note that in Queens and beyond the requirement for keystonemiddleware
has been removed from Ceilometer, so this fix cannot be placed on
the master branch.

also, change to make gnocchi install from pip rather than master

Change-Id: Ibea7049f9fca0783b9ecf54a75bccbc27aef2187

commit_message:
Detach function from underlying orchestrator

This is an admin only operation. which gives admin user a safe way to
clean up the underlying resources allocated for the function.

Change-Id: If98ab5235902516f98be7d485e744cf3ea4cd262

commit_message:
Fix wrong IPA images URL and file names

* the tarballs are called ironic-python-agent.tar
* ironic-python-agent.vmlinuz is a deprecated symlink to
  ironic-python-agent.kernel, which has been recently removed.

Change-Id: Id0e3eabcc24e8ea2a6589796f9efc955a591c9db

commit_message:
fix random broken pipe on du command

We have a broken pipe failure [1] randomly that is
causing elastic recheck to kickin.

Closes-Bug: #1731289
Change-Id: I826f3f9e2bae6f8ca97e1024c8860789e80e88fa

[{'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:10:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:10:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23401, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you so much Duc Truong!

Can I understand it as:

The greenthread need to check the action's status to check whether its in "WAITING_LIFECYCLE_COMPLETION" status? So that:
 - TIMEOUT: process the action
 - NOT TIMEOUT: action.status==READY then process it'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Thank you so much Duc Truong!
 > 
 > Can I understand it as:
 > 
 > The greenthread need to check the action's status to check whether
 > its in "WAITING_LIFECYCLE_COMPLETION" status? So that:
 > - TIMEOUT: process the action
 > - NOT TIMEOUT: action.status==READY then process it

Yes.  If the timeout happens and the action's status is still WAITING_LIFECYCLE_COMPLETION, then it will set the action to READY and process it.  If the timeout happens and the action's status is not WAITING_LIFECYCLE_COMPLETION, do nothing.'}, {'account_id': 23401, 'date': '2017-12-01 01:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Thank you so much Duc Truong!
 > >
 > > Can I understand it as:
 > >
 > > The greenthread need to check the action's status to check
 > whether
 > > its in "WAITING_LIFECYCLE_COMPLETION" status? So that:
 > > - TIMEOUT: process the action
 > > - NOT TIMEOUT: action.status==READY then process it
 > 
 > Yes.  If the timeout happens and the action's status is still
 > WAITING_LIFECYCLE_COMPLETION, then it will set the action to READY
 > and process it.  If the timeout happens and the action's status is
 > not WAITING_LIFECYCLE_COMPLETION, do nothing.
Great, the message sinking part could be scaleable so that user can be able to add plugins/functionality to dock their own MQ or service to notify them and say "hi I want to destroy 2 nodes" :)'}, {'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2017-12-04 07:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23401, 'date': '2017-12-05 06:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2017-12-05 13:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2017-12-05 13:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 19:10:08.000000000', 'message': "Add lifecycle hook spec

The AWS autoscaling service provides a 'lifecycle hook' feature that Senlin
currently lacks. Lifecycle hooks during scaling operations allow the user or
an application to perform custom setup or clean-up of instances. This spec
only addresses lifecycle hooks to perform custom clean-up of instances
during scale-in actions as this is most common case.

Change-Id: I61ddf4b5e560f3c913fa962665d43048090ef3ed
"}, {'created': '2017-12-08 23:25:35.000000000', 'message': "Add lifecycle hook spec

The AWS autoscaling service provides a 'lifecycle hook' feature that Senlin
currently lacks. Lifecycle hooks during scaling operations allow the user or
an application to perform custom setup or clean-up of instances.

Change-Id: I61ddf4b5e560f3c913fa962665d43048090ef3ed
"}, {'created': '2017-12-10 06:35:14.000000000', 'message': "Add lifecycle hook spec

The AWS autoscaling service provides a 'lifecycle hook' feature that Senlin
currently lacks. Lifecycle hooks during scaling operations allow the user or
an application to perform custom setup or clean-up of instances.

Change-Id: I61ddf4b5e560f3c913fa962665d43048090ef3ed
"}]
commit_message:
Add lifecycle hook spec

The AWS autoscaling service provides a 'lifecycle hook' feature that Senlin
currently lacks. Lifecycle hooks during scaling operations allow the user or
an application to perform custom setup or clean-up of instances.

Change-Id: I61ddf4b5e560f3c913fa962665d43048090ef3ed

In order to apply pep8 check to app.wsgi,

Change-Id: I4b2ccb1dc5a42f3d2c9ad4009c7563ff472338ea

commit_message:
Rename app.wsgi to wsgi.py

panko/api/app.wsgi should meet pep8 standards.

In order to apply pep8 check to app.wsgi,
as suggestion from Gordon Chung, we can change the file name to wsgi.py

Change-Id: I4b2ccb1dc5a42f3d2c9ad4009c7563ff472338ea

commit_message:
Workaround ansible lint failure

This skips the ANSIBLE0006 issue asking to use systemd module
instead of systemctl command.

Change-Id: I774829efd763da2400062574bc8266e544d6f75d

commit_message:
Align stars on stable/jewel CI

1) Use older puppetlabs-apache
The 2.2.0 release of puppetlabs apache broke the fastcgi support for el7
which this module used. This change updates the requirements and fixes
the CI to use at most 2.1.0 and switches to use the stable/pike
requirements which has puppetlabs-apache 2.0.0

2) Update bindep for puppet-tarball job.

3) Fix zuul configuration for complex branching.

Depends-On: Ie11af4944178fa057a189f4e0c7e4809dc694b86
Change-Id: I7038cd1267b68658d233f39a8fc7fc8bc423ad7b

[{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2017-12-04 06:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2017-12-04 06:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2017-12-04 08:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-04 13:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

You can't just change a default config value like this. It will break any users out there who depend on its current default without any warning. At a bare minimum you need to have a release note explaining the update implications here. Although I'm not convinced that is enough here, especially given the limited value of this change weighed against the potential breakage for users. The commit message doesn't contain any details on why the default needs to change either, making it hard to judge."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2017-12-14 08:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not needed'}]

commit_message:
Add a termination scenario test

When the user specifies end_time and executes update API,
check that resources are correctly released at lease end time.
It confirm that the instance created during the lease period
have been removed by lease end.

Change-Id: Ic1076905ad5f2fc894036b045743eacb5c2db9bd
Partial-bug: #1694181

Change-Id: Ifa121fe56a6bdc7376b5a79800eae0f4d3f6b4f0

commit_message:
Force gzip compression when file has a lot of links

gzip during log collection sometimes fails because there are too
many levels of links in log directory. This change use gzip --force
flag to make it work in this scenario.

Change-Id: Ifa121fe56a6bdc7376b5a79800eae0f4d3f6b4f0

subject: Add missing hostname to nodename in RabbitMQ for multinode deployment
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 7488, 'name': 'Jeffrey Zhang', 'email': 'zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com', 'username': 'Jeffrey4l'}, {'_account_id': 12882, 'name': 'Taeha Kim', 'email': 'kthguru@gmail.com', 'username': 'kthguru'}, {'_account_id': 14119, 'name': 'Sam Yaple', 'email': 'sam+git@yaple.net', 'username': 'SamYaple'}, {'_account_id': 17669, 'name': 'Doug Szumski', 'email': 'doug@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'DougSzumski'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22582, 'name': 'Duong Ha-Quang', 'email': 'quangduongha@gmail.com', 'username': 'duonghq'}, {'_account_id': 26556, 'name': 'SongHao', 'email': 'songhao@gohighsec.com', 'username': 'SongHao'}]

[{'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-01 05:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-01 05:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-01 06:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-01 06:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-01 08:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-01 11:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-11-01 12:21:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi, I'm not seeing the issue you're describing. Can you give more info on your setup?"}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-01 17:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

this is fine as long as ansible_hostname matches api_interface_address'}, {'account_id': 26556, 'date': '2017-11-03 01:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Does this affect already deployed environments when change the name of a node?'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:21:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I also don't see this - are you running multiple instances of rabbit per host? The change looks sensible."}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Does this affect already deployed environments when change the name
 > of a node?

If RABBITMQ_NODENAME is changed, it will be required to change related configuration manually or re-deploy with new name.
But, if RABBITMQ_NODENAME of a node is changed to any name without hostname or hostname is missing, the node will gone away from RabbitMQ clustering. 

1) In RabbitMQ Management console (15672), 
The node status will be "Node not running".

2) docker logs rabbitmq
=INFO REPORT==== 3-Nov-2017::21:10:18 ===
Ignoring invalid user-provided configuration
=INFO REPORT==== 3-Nov-2017::21:10:18 ===
Clusterer stopping node now.

Other nodes are fine except for the node above.'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:33:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> I also don't see this - are you running multiple instances of
 > rabbit per host? The change looks sensible.

There are some testbeds using baremetal. In case of one of them, it has 3-RabbitMQ clusters. Each host has a RabbitMQ instance, i.e., 3-node RabbitMQ is running.

Strangeously, there was no problem in single node (all-in-one). But in case of multiple node (multinode), there was a problem as follows:

=INFO REPORT==== 3-Nov-2017::21:10:18 ===
Ignoring invalid user-provided configuration
=INFO REPORT==== 3-Nov-2017::21:10:18 ===
Clusterer stopping node now."}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> this is fine as long as ansible_hostname matches api_interface_address

Thank you for reviewing. It seems important thing to consider matching between them like you pointed it.'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:50:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Hi, I'm not seeing the issue you're describing. Can you give more
 > info on your setup?

There are some testbeds using baremetal. In case of one of them, it has 3-RabbitMQ clusters. Each host has a RabbitMQ instance, i.e., 3-node RabbitMQ is running.

Is there any other questions? Please let me know. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-11-03 12:51:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-12-13 15:37:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-12-13 16:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 12882, 'date': '2017-12-14 00:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-12-14 02:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 22582, 'date': '2017-12-14 08:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-01 05:53:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add host name in RabbitMQ to support multiple nodes

When a RabbitMQ node in multiple RabbitMQ nodes is started during
multinode deployment, it is required to communicate with each other
to be clustered. However, RabbitMQ nodes cannot communicate between
them due to missing host name in the nodename environment variable
of RabbitMQ. Subsequently, all of RabbitMQs cannot be started and
it will give rise to deployment fail.

Change-Id: I7b4ba76807750db4a14d859454ba650bdaaf23ca
Signed-off-by: Taeha Kim <kthguru@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-11-01 05:55:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add host name in RabbitMQ to support multiple nodes

multinode deployment, it is required to communicate with each other

commit_message:
Add missing hostname to nodename in RabbitMQ for multinode deployment

When a RabbitMQ node in multiple RabbitMQ nodes is started during
multinode deployment, it is required to communicate with each other
to be clustered. However, RabbitMQ nodes cannot communicate between
them due to missing host name in the nodename environment variable
of RabbitMQ. Subsequently, all of RabbitMQs cannot be started and
it will give rise to a deployment failure.

Change-Id: I7b4ba76807750db4a14d859454ba650bdaaf23ca
Signed-off-by: Taeha Kim <kthguru@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Should not get domain_scoped token when no multidomain support

The current version is trying to get domain_scoped token when
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT is FALSE, which causes
the unnecessary "Attempted scope to domain Default failed, will
attempt to scope to another domain." message in the backend

Change-Id: Iceb16267cd5b99581da4905766400fde59d717e1
Closes-bug: #1738135

[{'created': '2017-12-13 07:12:25.000000000', 'message': 'remove eventlet and monkey patch

Using eventlet for rpc enforces using eventlet.monkey_patch caused all
vitrage to affectivly use a single thread.
With this change, vitrage may use actual threads (mostly affects the main processor process).
This change passed thorough testing.

Change-Id: I71991d6f795e5c503c7226523e36c4fb7ab3835c
'}]
commit_message:
remove eventlet and monkey patch

Using eventlet for rpc enforces using eventlet.monkey_patch caused all
vitrage to affectivly use a single thread.
With this change, vitrage may use actual threads (mostly affects the main processor process).
This change passed thorough testing.

Change-Id: I71991d6f795e5c503c7226523e36c4fb7ab3835c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-13 21:16:05.000000000', 'message': "Create and use a local LXC RPM repo

CentOS deployments require a special COPR repository for modern LXC
packages. The COPR repository isn't mirrored at this time and this
causes failed gate tests and production deployments.

The role now syncs the LXC packages down from COPR to each host and
builds a local LXC package repository in `/opt/thm-lxc2.0`. This
greatly reduces the amount of times that packages must be downloaded
from the COPR server during deployments, which will reduce failures
until the packages can be hosted with a more reliable source.

In addition, this should speed up playbook runs since ``yum`` can
check a locally-hosted repository instead of a remote repository
with availability and performance challenges.

Partial-Bug: 1730380
Change-Id: I8726b46f4058bb67709246785c7a61278eb64fab
(cherry picked from commit 499eb6fe2167fcf4c5c1687e828c39c896b2c618)
"}]
commit_message:
Create and use a local LXC RPM repo

CentOS deployments require a special COPR repository for modern LXC
packages. The COPR repository isn't mirrored at this time and this
causes failed gate tests and production deployments.

The role now syncs the LXC packages down from COPR to each host and
builds a local LXC package repository in `/opt/thm-lxc2.0`. This
greatly reduces the amount of times that packages must be downloaded
from the COPR server during deployments, which will reduce failures
until the packages can be hosted with a more reliable source.

In addition, this should speed up playbook runs since ``yum`` can
check a locally-hosted repository instead of a remote repository
with availability and performance challenges.

Partial-Bug: 1730380
Change-Id: I8726b46f4058bb67709246785c7a61278eb64fab
(cherry picked from commit 499eb6fe2167fcf4c5c1687e828c39c896b2c618)

commit_message:
Create a test matrix role

Modify test-matrix.py so that is can be used as an ansible module.
Add a role in d-g that runs test matrix for the given branch,
role and features file.

Change-Id: Ie36ba0cd7cfcd450b75000a76a64d856f2a83eba

commit_message:
Allow jobs to disable all services

Several legacy jobs use the OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES variable
from d-g so set the list of services that should be enabled and
ignore the default set calculated via the feature matrix.

Add support for a similar functionality in the zuulv3 jobs
using the 'disable_all_services' localconf function.

Change-Id: I690554ec62cef3be600054071efbb3f92a99249e

commit_message:
DPDK derive params network config validation

This change is to fail the action and provide validation message
when get_network_config action is unable to determine the network
config for any role.

Change-Id: Ieeaf6e74360b782990633385771cd3d3a46152c8
Closes-Bug: #1714474

commit_message:
Memory channels parameter default value

This change is to add memory channels parameter with default
value as "4" and it can be updated based on hardware spec.
Memory channels parameter is not derivable in mistral derive
parameters using introspection memory bank data since format
of memory slot name is not consitent on different environments.

Change-Id: I753861c69e64d341e313e8878ac629136aa5852c
Closes-Bug: #1734814

[{'created': '2017-12-06 06:36:22.000000000', 'message': "List all deps when installing

By default bindep will only list missing packages, but we want to list
all packages. If we don't then some packages may have been automatically
pulled in and they will get automatically removed (like ldap)

Change-Id: I5e0b3bc8e1e41556c9e61e6e215dc90b4ee50ecd

commit_message:
List all deps when installing

By default bindep will only list missing packages, but we want to list
all packages. If we don't then some packages may have been automatically
pulled in and they will get automatically removed (like ldap)

Change-Id: I5e0b3bc8e1e41556c9e61e6e215dc90b4ee50ecd

subject: 'get_volume_type_by_backendname' returns a list
messages:
[{'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2017-11-27 07:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2017-12-07 05:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

licanwei, it is bit unclear to me, a same cinder volume backend can be  set in different volume types, so get_volume_type_by_backend name can return multiple volume types.'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2017-12-08 03:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So this function should return a list of volume types,not just one type.'}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2017-12-11 04:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2017-12-14 06:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 07:29:46.000000000', 'message': "'get_volume_type_by_backendname' returns a list

Storage pool can have many volume types,
'get_volume_type_by_backendname' should return a list of types.

Closes-Bug: #1733257
Change-Id: I877d5886259e482089ed0f9944d97bb99f375824
"}]
commit_message:
'get_volume_type_by_backendname' returns a list

Storage pool can have many volume types,
'get_volume_type_by_backendname' should return a list of types.

Closes-Bug: #1733257
Change-Id: I877d5886259e482089ed0f9944d97bb99f375824

commit_message:
Replace LOG.warn with LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: Id9a05a4dcb694b42bf68295bab655435b177f4d1

commit_message:
Update protobuf 3.5.0 to post1

Noticed stack failures due to protobuf==3.5.0 not found.  It seems
there was a problem with the package and it no longer exists on
pypi.

There's a post1 version up, and modifying constraints to point to
that instead seems to fix up the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1734009

Change-Id: Id457f8bf302f15ad082ab8381c1ccd894352f8aa

commit_message:
Make sure pg_num is updated before pgp_num.

We need to order the change because pgp makes a check on the pg
number.

Closes-Bug: #1730457

Change-Id: I2983de1448ce4e4bbbfffb970a1d0f082854d879
(cherry picked from commit 7a366f92a53cc9015d3aaeab86e36c3d1649cf79)

[{'created': '2017-12-12 06:55:02.000000000', 'message': "python3: long does not exist in python 3

In Python 2 there are two integer types 'int' and 'float',
but in Python 3 'int' handles all integers.
In python 2, future.builtins.int provides python3-compatible int.

blueprint django2-support
Change-Id: Ic9e054a0e5015d60cfc966e70409a3016719ae11
"}, {'created': '2017-12-12 10:56:34.000000000', 'message': "python3: long does not exist in python 3

Change-Id: Ic9e054a0e5015d60cfc966e70409a3016719ae11
"}]
commit_message:
python3: long does not exist in python 3

In Python 2 there are two integer types 'int' and 'float',
but in Python 3 'int' handles all integers.

blueprint django2-support
Change-Id: Ic9e054a0e5015d60cfc966e70409a3016719ae11

commit_message:
Add text download service

To add functionality for text download within client-side,
this patch adds text-download.service.
This service realize to download text file from text contents and file name
within  only browser.
This function will be used for download key pair after its creation.

Change-Id: Id079fa38c0ac0e79666fa7c5469afd58bf5228d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 18:59:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add update groups types API endpoint to volumes v3 library

This PS adds update group types API to v3 ``group_types_client``
library; min_microversion of this API is 3.11 [0].

Included in this PS:

* Update group types API to group_types_client
* Unit tests for update API
* API test for update API

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html#id11

commit_message:
Add update groups types API endpoint to volumes v3 library

This PS adds update group types API to v3 ``group_types_client``
library; min_microversion of this API is 3.11 [0].

Included in this PS:

* Update group types API to group_types_client
* Unit tests for update API
* API test for update API

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html#id11

Change-Id: Ie3834c1a4b3ebd1463cdaacc86cd21b7be9fa3ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-13 18:47:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing keystone_domain_config

When configuring the keystone LDAP integration we need to write out
domain configuration items using the keystone_domain_config provider.
Since this tag was missed in the docker conversion, the configuration
was not actually available in the docker container.

Change-Id: I7abdfdd55e38da80768c907863fa06429debf9cd
Closes-Bug: #1737799
(cherry picked from commit 40530c0e8c1bd28244db947309fe5b19010d3f4e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing keystone_domain_config

When configuring the keystone LDAP integration we need to write out
domain configuration items using the keystone_domain_config provider.
Since this tag was missed in the docker conversion, the configuration
was not actually available in the docker container.

Change-Id: I7abdfdd55e38da80768c907863fa06429debf9cd
Closes-Bug: #1737799
(cherry picked from commit 40530c0e8c1bd28244db947309fe5b19010d3f4e)

subject: Add env var for custom ssh user
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9317, 'date': '2017-12-13 12:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-13 23:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 09:32:17.000000000', 'message': "Add env var for custom ssh user

W/o an env var, a dynamic inventory can't be invoked for a custom
user. Ansible uses the same ANSIBLE_SSH_USER so the value will
be aligned to both.

Related-bug: #1734298

Change-Id: Ieddbb4c87d88888f78d494ff670db907bce4fd78
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit fde797ca14b194f588a46256c809729c2ef0135d)
"}]
commit_message:
Add env var for custom ssh user

W/o an env var, a dynamic inventory can't be invoked for a custom
user. Ansible uses the same ANSIBLE_SSH_USER so the value will
be aligned to both.

Related-bug: #1734298

Change-Id: Ieddbb4c87d88888f78d494ff670db907bce4fd78
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit fde797ca14b194f588a46256c809729c2ef0135d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-12 18:12:56.000000000', 'message': 'Create config-download dir in tripleo-bootstrap role

Instead of creating the /var/lib/heat-config/tripleo-config-download
directory before every individual server deployment, we should just do
it one time. Move the task to the new tripleo-bootstrap role which is
run at the beginning before any deployments.

Change-Id: Id8706f61df717bbe614aade659ff13b857e7f9dd
Closes-Bug: #1737801
'}]
commit_message:
Create config-download dir in tripleo-bootstrap role

Instead of creating the /var/lib/heat-config/tripleo-config-download
directory before every individual server deployment, we should just do
it one time. Move the task to the new tripleo-bootstrap role which is
run at the beginning before any deployments.

Change-Id: Id8706f61df717bbe614aade659ff13b857e7f9dd
Closes-Bug: #1737801

Add -c for clean_templates

Add a new option to process-templates.py that will clean the working
template directory of any generated template files.

commit_message:
Set barbican to be configured in step 3

Barbican is set to be configured in step 3 after keystone.
This allows other services (like swift) to use barbican to store
and retrieve configuration secrets.

Change-Id: Ie486473d001b10a23374b55369431b4c2bb85419

(14 comments)

For this patch, we should just focus on the conductor -> select_destinations code, getting the list of lists of Selection objects back and having conductor deal with those client-side. The compute and resource tracker code should all be unchanged. If/when we start sending SchedulerLimits to the compute, that should be done using a compute RPC API service version bump to indicate when the computes can handle getting that type of object. For now, the compute rpcapi client can handle converting the SchedulerLimits object to a dict before sending it to the compute.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2017-12-05 00:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

So what you were doing in PS17:

[{'created': '2017-10-31 14:59:08.000000000', 'message': 'Change RPC for select_destinations()

This changes the RPC call for select_destinations() as made by the
conductor. The previous patch added the logic on the scheduler side;
this patch changes the conductor side to use the two new parameters that
flag the new behaviors for Selection objects and alternate hosts.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

commit_message:
Change RPC for select_destinations()

This changes the RPC call for select_destinations() as made by the
conductor. The previous patch added the logic on the scheduler side;
this patch changes the conductor side to use the two new parameters that
flag the new behaviors for Selection objects and alternate hosts.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: I70b11dd489d222be3d70733355bfe7966df556aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 15:46:04.000000000', 'message': 'Move segment deletion back to PRECOMMIT_DELETE

This essentially reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to
BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of them,
it is not possible to delete a routed network, because the segments
cannot be deleted due to the fact that the associated subnets still
exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE
introduces a StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the
deleted segments. To work around that, network_db is expired and
read again after notifying the PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in
delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

This also fixes an issue where we could delete the segment ID
of the l3-ha network when deleting a router, leaving all other
routers non-functioning.  Moving this to PRECOMMIT_DELETE fixes
it since it is done after we have checked that the network is
not in use and can be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1697324
Closes-Bug: #1732543

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f
'}]
commit_message:
Move segment deletion back to PRECOMMIT_DELETE

This essentially reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd.

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to
BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of them,
it is not possible to delete a routed network, because the segments
cannot be deleted due to the fact that the associated subnets still
exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE
introduces a StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the
deleted segments. To work around that, network_db is expired and
read again after notifying the PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in
delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

This also fixes an issue where we could delete the segment ID
of the l3-ha network when deleting a router, leaving all other
routers non-functioning.  Moving this to PRECOMMIT_DELETE fixes
it since it is done after we have checked that the network is
not in use and can be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1697324
Closes-Bug: #1732543

Change-Id: I7c3c4654f183b317647a28d599a538fe460db68f

commit_message:
Add neutron base profile to OVN metadata agent

This patch is including neutron base profile in OVN metadata agent
file. This will ensure that neutron configuration is also applied
for this service.

Change-Id: If3dffde5e0db8f7607a9708d36d54d1600fe5da8

commit_message:
Align tox_install.sh with other projects

The tox_install.sh here behaves a bit differently than the others, which
is causing some problems when trying to rework some of the shared gate jobs.

Align it to the form used in other repos.

Change-Id: I3d2b391fba9be6290eb245924014134fbdde717a

I'll go back and hit the comments from the last set; in the meantime this addresses the swap changes on the Nova side.  I'm getting around the call-back problem a bit for the retype case (live-volume-migration) by checking on the attachment-delete if the attachment id has already been deleted on the cinder side.

This way we can return that the attachment is deleted.  May be a better option, but for now this may be the way to go from Cinder's perspective.

The nova issues volume-update should just work here, retype from cinder works with cinder changes, and cinder migrate flat out doesn't work in Cinder regardless of attach API versions."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-09 05:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: Verified-1

recheck linuxbridge timeout'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-07-21 02:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 96: Code-Review-1

(33 comments)

I've got a bunch of concerns about how the tests are done in here. To summarize, this is changing a lot of the tests that cover the old style attachment flows and turns them into new style attachment flows, which is wrong IMO. We should leave the old tests alone, and write new tests for new code. This is one way to tell that we're not changing the old flows - but it's also simply easier on the reviewer to know what's going on.

Second, I'm totally confused as to what's going on with the changing of the return values for the attachment_create and attachment_update methods in nova.volume.cinder - I'm going to need some help there. Did the Cinder API change something with how the connection_info works for the 3.27 API and now the client (nova in this case) has to fill in the gaps? That seems like a pretty big change if so. If we do need to change all of that, I'd rather see it split out into a separate refactor patch that comes before this one since it's already hard to review the new functionality so mixing in a refactor doesn't help.

Lastly, we're going to need a release note for this to mention that Nova is now using the Cinder 3.27 API for volume attachments if (1) Cinder >= 3.27 is available and (2) all of the nova-compute services are upgraded. And that 3.27 is only used for new volume attachments; existing volume attachments are going to use the 3.0 APIs."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-21 03:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 96:

Looks like the blockdev errors are mostly coming from this patch, or probably other changes that depend on this patch, since it's all in the check queue:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message%3A%5C%22blockdev%3A%20cannot%20open%20%2Fdev%2F%5C%22%20AND%20message%3A%5C%22No%20such%20device%20or%20address%5C%22%20AND%20tags%3A%5C%22screen-n-cpu.txt%5C%22&from=7d"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-07-26 12:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 106: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 17386, 'date': '2017-07-26 13:21:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 104:

you can ignore the above 2 comments, I didn't have the full set of patches."}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2017-07-26 18:18:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 106:

Yep, I saw them. It's under investigation of what's happening there and how to fix it, I hope it will get all done today."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2017-07-26 22:02:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 106:

@Matt
It appears that the problem that's causing those traces is because we're cheating and building a BDM without connecting to the host in the new attach flow (we just reserve the volume on the Cinder node and build an empty/reserved bdm entry).  This ends up causing a problem because the periodic that runs and inspects the volume usage then tries to interrogate that bdm entry, but it's not actually attached so the disk interrogation fails/raises and we get this error.  Later, when you unshelve and the connection is made the device is present and the periodic then of course passes.

I'll look into whehter I can make it behave more like the old attach code here, or come up with another solution."}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2017-07-27 03:53:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 106:

If we could end up with a solution to this issue and keep a seemingly more reasonable flow that would be great in my opinion. But let's see first what our options are.

Thanks for investigating it John!"}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2017-07-28 00:55:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 106:

Digging at this more it's interesting that the error seems to be related to the libvirt error:
    http://logs.openstack.org/85/330285/106/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-py35-ubuntu-xenial/40072bb/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE#_Jul_26_09_34_33_062305

As it turns out, these all seem to have that signature for an instance failure, and subsequently the volume isn't cleaned up (nor is the instance) so the periodic keeps trying to hit it and fails.

There's also something strange going on here with the compute host not found error above it??"}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2017-08-01 08:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 106:

This is also a valid failure:

http://logs.openstack.org/85/330285/144/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/89229f6/console.html#_2017-10-10_13_20_50_869875

I spent a few hours today investigating that failure. The test does this:

1. create a server and wait for it to be active
2. create a volume and wait for it to be available
3. attach the volume to the server and wait for it to be in-use
4. reboot the server and wait for it to be active
5. ssh and check that the block device is still in the guest
6. teardown - which attempts to detach the volume, but it fails because the volume status is now 'attaching' rather than 'in-use' for some reason:

http://logs.openstack.org/85/330285/144/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/89229f6/console.html#_2017-10-10_13_20_50_909920

We need to test the new flow in nova/virt/block_device.py. We can easily tickle that by doing:

diff --git a/nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py b/nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py
index 4dced98..a7ea4c9 100644
--- a/nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py
+++ b/nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py
@@ -1131,3 +1131,14 @@ class TestDriverBlockDevice(test.NoDBTestCase):
         # can't assert_not_called if the method isn't in the spec.
         self.assertFalse(hasattr(test_eph, 'refresh_connection_info'))
         self.assertFalse(hasattr(test_swap, 'refresh_connection_info'))
+
+
+class TestDriverBlockDeviceNewFlow(TestDriverBlockDevice):
+    """Virt block_device tests for the Cinder 3.44 volume attach flow
+    where a volume BDM has an attachment_id.
+    """
+    def setUp(self):
+        super(TestDriverBlockDeviceNewFlow, self).setUp()
+        # Setting an attachment_id on the volume BDM will mark it as a
+        # "new style" attachment.
+        self.volume_bdm.attachment_id = uuids.attachment_id


That generates 12 test failures because of tests assuming they should call things like initialize_connection which are now calling attachment_update.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-05 21:08:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 170: Workflow-1

I'm fixing the other failing functional test, and adding the unit tests for nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-05 21:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 170:
